name: ProMedica Hickman Hospital Opening Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Hickman Hospital Opening Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Hickman Hospital Opening

Press Release
ProMedica Hickman Hospital Opening

ADRIAN, Mich., May 27, 2020 - The opening date of the new ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital is looking at a short delay to equip the hospital with additional safety features. The new hospital opening date for patient care is September 24, 2020.

ProMedica has re-assessed the Hickman facility and design, and decided to add state-of-the-art precautionary measures to provide a safe, healthy environment for all patients and employees. These measures include increasing the number of negative pressure patient care rooms in the emergency department and the labor and delivery, critical care, and medical/surgical care units; installing plexiglass barriers at patient registration and in areas where high volumes might tend to congregate; and incorporating ultra-violet lights into the air ducts, which helps to disinfect the heating and cooling units and reduce the spread of germs.

ProMedica is leveraging the lessons learned from the recent pandemic to help ensure a safe environment for staff and patients going forward. By implementing the new measures, the hospital will be better prepared to respond to COVID-19 and similar outbreaks should it need to do so in the future.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Makes 2020 Beckers Hospital Review List of 100 Great Hospitals in America Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Makes 2020 Becker's Hospital Review List of '100 Great Hospitals in America' Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Makes 2020 Becker's Hospital Review List of '100 Great Hospitals in America'

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Makes 2020 Beckerâ€™s Hospital Review List of â€˜100 Great Hospitals in Americaâ€™

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 26, 2020 – ProMedica Toledo Hospital has been named to Becker's Hospital Review’s list of "100 Great Hospitals in America." ProMedica Toledo Hospital is the only hospital in northwest Ohio to be recognized by Becker’s with this prestigious honor.

Becker’s based its analysis on excellence in clinical care, patient outcomes, and staff and physician satisfaction. Only industry leaders with advanced accreditation and certification in several specialties were recognized among the top 100 great hospitals in America. The list also includes industry innovators that have sparked trends in health care technology, hospital management and patient satisfaction.

“It’s the talented and dedicated employees and providers at ProMedica who truly make us great,” says Dawn Buskey, president of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. “Thanks to their relentless dedication to quality and safety, we continue to distinguish ourselves nationally.”

Becker's profile of ProMedica reads: “ProMedica Toledo Hospital employs more than 4,800 healthcare professionals, including more than 1,000 primary care and specialty physicians, who serve patients across 27 counties in northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan. U.S. News & World Report ranked the 794-bed hospital No. 1 in Toledo and among the top 10 in Ohio in its 2019-20 rankings. Healthgrades also named ProMedica Toledo Hospital one of the 50 Best Hospitals in the nation for clinical excellence in 2020 for the third consecutive year.”

Becker's Healthcare selected the hospitals for inclusion based on analysis of ranking and award agencies, including U.S. News & World Report's 2019-20 rankings, CareChex, Healthgrades, CMS star ratings, Leapfrog grades and IBM Watson Health top hospitals.

The full list can be found here.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Earns Three Stars in the Vascular Quality Initiative Registry Participation Award Program Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Earns Three Stars in the Vascular Quality Initiative Registry Participation Award Program Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Earns Three Stars in the Vascular Quality Initiative Registry Participation Award Program

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Earns Three Stars in the Vascular Quality Initiative Registry Participation Award Program

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 19, 2020 – The Society for Vascular Surgery’s Vascular Quality Initiative (SVS VQI) has awarded ProMedica Toledo Hospital three out of three stars for its active participation in the Registry Participation Program.

The mission of the SVS VQI is to improve patient safety and the quality of vascular care delivery by providing web-based collection, aggregation and analysis of clinical data submitted in registry format for all patients undergoing specific vascular treatments. The VQI operates 14 vascular registries.

The participation awards program began in 2016 to encourage active participation in the registries program and recognize the importance of that participation.

Participating centers can earn up to three stars based on actions that lead to better patient care, including:

  • The completeness of long-term, follow-up reporting, based on the percentage of patients for whom they have at least nine months of follow-up data
  • Physician attendance at semi-annual meetings of a regional quality group
  • Initiation of quality improvement activities based on VQI data
  • The number of vascular registries in which the center participates

VQI’s registries contain demographic, clinical, procedural and outcomes data from more than 670,000 vascular procedures performed in the U.S. and Canada. Each record includes information from the patient’s initial hospitalization and at one-year follow-up.

The wealth of data allows centers and providers to compare their performance to regional and national benchmarks. All centers and providers receive biannual dashboards and regular performance reports, so they can use their data to support quality improvement initiatives.

“Our team uses VQI data for all of our quality improvement projects. It is an extremely valuable tool that provides real-time feedback on the impact of our programs,” said Gregory Kasper, MD, FACS, MBA, vice president of medical affairs – metro region at ProMedica and president and chief medical officer of Jobst Vascular Institute at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. “Educationally, we use VQI for continued faculty development and feedback for our trainees. I can’t imagine trying to run a service line without this type of ongoing outcomes assessment.”

Biannual regional meetings allow physicians of different specialties, nurses, data managers, quality officers and others to meet, share information and ideas, and learn from each other in a positive and supportive environment. Members have used VQI data to significantly improve the delivery of vascular care at local, regional, and national levels, reducing complications and expenses.

“Hard-working, dedicated organizations such as the Jobst Vascular Institute at ProMedica Toledo Hospital are key to the success of the vascular registries,” said VQI Medical Director Dr. Jens Eldrup-Jorgensen. “The work we do to build and maintain the registries for researcher use is crucial to health and outcomes for vascular patients. Like the old saying says, ‘if you can’t measure it, you can’t improve it.’”

name: ProMedica Announces Plan for a Freestanding Emergency Department and More Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces Plan for a Freestanding Emergency Department and More Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces Plan for a Freestanding Emergency Department and More

Press Release
ProMedica Announces Plan for a Freestanding Emergency Department and More

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 14, 2020 – ProMedica today announced its plan to build a freestanding emergency department to support the growing needs of residents and businesses in Maumee and the surrounding area. The new facility will be the second location of the ProMedica Toledo Hospital emergency department. It is expected to be conveniently located on Anthony Wayne Trail near the I-475 Interchange. “ProMedica’s metro area hospitals already treat a sizable number of patients from Maumee and the surrounding area,” said Dawn Buskey, President, Metro Region Acute Care at ProMedica.”Our new freestanding emergency department will bring the high-quality compassionate care they count on even closer to home.”

The freestanding emergency department will be fully equipped with state-of-the-art technology and resources, enabling patients to obtain CT scans, X-rays, ultrasounds, lab services, and more onsite as appropriate. Patients will be able to receive treatment for a range of emergency conditions, including chest pain, stroke, severe shortness of breath, trauma injuries, allergic reactions, severe gastrointestinal symptoms, seizures, severe pain, uncontrollable bleeding, broken bones, cuts, burns and more. Should a condition require additional advanced treatment, surgery or inpatient care, patients would be stabilized and transported to the top-rated, nationally recognized ProMedica Toledo Hospital main campus.

Additionally, the new facility will include an urgent care for minor injuries and illness. By combining a freestanding emergency department and urgent care within the same facility, patients will be able to quickly receive the most appropriate and cost-effective care at one location.

Pending final plan approvals, construction of the 11,000 square-foot facility is expected to begin in the summer of 2020 with a grand opening slated for the summer of 2021. Approximately two dozen jobs are expected to be created with the opening of the new facility, including those in the areas of nursing, registration and environmental services.

name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital Awarded Primary Stroke Certification From The Joint Commission Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital Awarded Primary Stroke Certification From The Joint Commission Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital Awarded Primary Stroke Certification From The Joint Commission

Press Release
ProMedica Memorial Hospital Awarded Primary Stroke Certification From The Joint Commission

FREMONT, Ohio, May 11, 2020 – ProMedica Memorial Hospital is proud to announce it has earned The Joint Commission’s Gold Seal of Approval® and the American Stroke Association’s Heart-Check mark for Primary Stroke Certification.

Memorial Hospital underwent a rigorous, unannounced onsite review in February 2020. During the visit, a team of Joint Commission reviewers evaluated compliance with related certification standards including management, supporting self-management and delivering and facilitating clinical care. Joint Commission standards are developed in consultation with health care experts and providers, measurement experts and patients. The reviewers also conducted onsite observations and interviews.

“Primary Stroke Certification recognizes health care organizations committed to fostering continuous quality improvement in patient safety and quality of care,” says Mark Pelletier, RN, MS, chief operating officer, Accreditation and Certification Operations, and chief nursing executive, The Joint Commission. “We commend Memorial Hospital for using certification to reduce variation in its clinical processes and to strengthen its program structure and management framework for stroke patients.”

“We congratulate Memorial Hospital for this outstanding achievement,” says Nancy Brown, chief executive officer, the American Stroke Association. “This certification reflects its commitment to providing the highest quality of care for stroke patients.”

“With stroke being the fifth leading cause of death for Americans, we know it’s important for the community to have a high-quality facility they can turn to for neurological care, such as stroke,” says Pam Jensen, president of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. “We’re proud to receive this certification as it truly demonstrates our commitment to our patients.”

“We know that when it comes to stroke, timing is everything,” says Robin LaLonde, stroke coordinator at ProMedica Memorial Hospital. “The CDC reports that every 40 seconds someone in the United States has a stroke, and we’re pleased to be a trusted site for stroke care for patients in the community.”

This National Stroke Awareness Month, Americans are encouraged to spot signs of stroke by using the letters in "F.A.S.T." which stands for Facial drooping, Arm weakness, Speech, and Time to call 9-1-1.

For more information about stroke services at ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org/stroke.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a member of ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization headquartered in Toledo, Ohio. ProMedica serves communities in 28 states. The organization offers acute and ambulatory care, an insurance company with a dental plan, and post-acute and academic business lines. The organization has more than 56,000 employees, 13 hospitals, 2,100+ physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, 900+ healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians, a health plan, and nearly 400 assisted living facilities, skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, and hospice and home health care agencies. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

name: ProMedica Bixby Hospital Receives an A for Patient Safety for the Spring 2020 Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Bixby Hospital Receives an 'A' for Patient Safety for the Spring 2020 Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Bixby Hospital Receives an 'A' for Patient Safety for the Spring 2020 Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade

Press Release
ProMedica Bixby Hospital Receives an â€˜Aâ€™ for Patient Safety for the Spring 2020 Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade

ADRIAN, MI, May 7, 2020 – ProMedica Bixby Hospital is proud to be awarded with an ‘A’ from The Leapfrog Group’s spring 2020 Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade. The designation recognizes Bixby Hospital’s efforts in protecting patients from harm and providing safer health care. The Leapfrog Group is a national nonprofit organization committed to improving health care quality and safety for consumers and purchasers. The Safety Grade assigns an ‘A’, ‘B’, ‘C’, ‘D’ or ‘F’ grade to hospitals across the country based on their performance in preventing medical errors, injuries, accidents, infections and other harms to patients in their care.

“We are honored to be formally recognized as a leader in patient safety, said Julie Yaroch, DO, president of ProMedica Bixby Hospital. The achievement recognizes the tireless efforts of our dedicated employees and providers, who continually strive to deliver the highest standard of care.”

Developed under the guidance of a national expert panel, the Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade uses 28 measures of publicly available hospital safety data to assign grades to more than 2,600 U.S. acute-care hospitals twice per year. Researchers found that when compared to “A” hospitals, patients at “D” and “F” hospitals face a 92% greater risk of avoidable death; patients at “C” hospitals on average face an 88% greater risk; and patients at “B” hospitals on average face a 35% greater risk. Overall, an estimated 160,000 lives are lost annually from the avoidable medical errors that are accounted for in the Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade, a significant improvement from 2016, when researchers estimated 205,000 avoidable deaths. The Hospital Safety Grade’s methodology is peer-reviewed and fully transparent, and the results are free to the public.

“To be recognized nationally as an ‘A’ hospital is an accomplishment the whole community should take pride in,” said Leah Binder, president and CEO of The Leapfrog Group. “Hospitals that earn an ‘A’ grade are making it a priority to protect patients from preventable medical harm and error. We congratulate hospital leaders, board members, staff, volunteers and clinicians who work so hard to earn this A.”

For more information about ProMedica Bixby Hospital, visit promedica.org/bixby.

name: ProMedica Cancels 2020 Summer Concert Series due to Coronavirus Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Cancels 2020 Summer Concert Series due to Coronavirus Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Cancels 2020 Summer Concert Series due to Coronavirus

Press Release
ProMedica Cancels 2020 Summer Concert Series due to Coronavirus

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 5, 2020 — ProMedica has canceled the 2020 ProMedica Summer Concert Series in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This year would have marked the fourth season of the ProMedica Summer Concert Series that transforms Promenade Park into a concert venue June through September.

“We’re really disappointed about canceling the ProMedica Summer Concert Series, as we expected it to be our best one yet,” said Tausha Moore, Director, Public Relations at ProMedica. “However, our main priority is the health and well-being of our community, and the latest information indicates that we’ll need to continue social distancing into the summer months to help minimize the impact of COVID-19.”

In 2019, ProMedica hosted 12 concerts representing 13 music genres. Almost ninety-thousand guests attended from 39 different states. Five hundred and sixty-five community members volunteered, and 32 companies sponsored the series. Fifteen non-profit organizations benefitted by receiving a portion of beverage sales.

Planning for the 2020 ProMedica Summer Concert Series was well underway before the COVID-19 pandemic was declared. ProMedica would like to recognize the generous sponsors that had already pledged their support prior to the cancelation: Coors Light, City of Toledo, Fifth Third Bank, Great Lakes Sound, Hylant, iHeartRadio, Laibe Electric/Technology, Owens Corning, Paramount and Stevens Disposal.

“We understand how disappointing this announcement may be to the tens of thousands of supporters who look forward to the concert series every year,” said Moore. “But, because the concerts attract such large crowds, we believe canceling the series is the socially responsible decision. We’re hoping to bring the concerts back next summer.”

name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Marks 90 Years of Serving the Community this May Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Marks 90 Years of Serving the Community this May Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Marks 90 Years of Serving the Community this May

Press Release
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Marks 90 Years of Serving the Community this May

FOSTORIA, Ohio, April 30, 2020 – This May, ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital marks an important milestone – its 90th birthday.

Construction on the new Fostoria City Hospital was nearing completion when the country fell into a deep economic depression in 1929, but the construction continued, and it opened on May 3, 1930. The hospital initially had 30 beds, with no maternity ward, intensive care unit, or special treatment areas. During the first few years of operation, the hospital had only 12 total personnel, including the superintendent, six registered nurses, one bookkeeper, one cook, one maid and one janitor. The hospital was named Fostoria City Hospital until the 1990s until it was renamed Fostoria Community Hospital.

Throughout the years Fostoria Community Hospital experienced many major changes, expansions and growth, including new hospital units, medical services and technology. A few most notable changes came in the 2000s. In 2000, the hospital became affiliated with ProMedica, ending its independent, public healthcare status and becoming a private hospital. In 2002, the hospital underwent it’s largest expansion which included a 30,000-square-foot addition on the south side of the hospital's emergency center, a brand new surgery department on the second floor, and upgraded radiology and diagnostic imaging capabilities. Then in 2003, Fostoria Community Hospital became designated as a Critical Access Hospital through a federal program that entitles small, rural hospitals to Medicare cost reimbursement.

While the hospital has seen enormous growth and change to its facility, the dedicated, compassionate care it provides to patients has not changed. “What makes Fostoria Community Hospital what it is today – a strong, anchor institution – I think of the doctors, nurses and staff. The individuals working at the hospital are committed to the Fostoria community and caring for the people they call their neighbors,” says Tom Borer, vice president of operations, ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital.

“Patients in the community can trust that when they walk through the doors of Fostoria Community Hospital, they will be seen by compassionate, dedicated staff, many of which have worked at the hospital since the start of their career,” said Marsha Cushman, DO, chief of staff, ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital.

Becky Bouillon, RN, community outreach coordinator, ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital, has worked at the hospital for over 42 years. As a lifelong resident of Fostoria, she is proud to have found a career in the town where she grew up. “The family atmosphere and caring employees are what has made my career at Fostoria Community Hospital so special. The names, faces and uniforms have changed, but the community commitment and focus on patient health has not,” she said. “If I had to do it all over again, I would choose to be a nurse at this community hospital.” “We’re really proud of our roots in the Fostoria community,” said Pam Jensen, president, regional acute care - Ohio and support services, ProMedica. “We understand that having access to high quality care is a critical part of a person’s health and well-being, and we’re always evaluating our programs and services to ensure we’re providing essential services to the community.”

Fostoria Community Hospital had a 90th anniversary celebration planned for staff and the community on May 11, 2020, but the hospital has postponed the gathering due to the Coronavirus. A new date will be determined later this year.

ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital is a member of ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization headquartered in Toledo, Ohio. ProMedica serves communities in 28 states. The organization offers acute and ambulatory care, an insurance company with a dental plan, and post-acute and academic business lines. The organization has more than 56,000 employees, 13 hospitals, 2,100+ physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, 900+ healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians, a health plan, and nearly 400 assisted living facilities, skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, and hospice and home health care agencies. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

name: Masks Needed Clarification to Sewing Fabric Masks
Title: Masks Needed: Clarification to Sewing Fabric Masks
Description:
Masks Needed: Clarification to Sewing Fabric Masks

Press Release
Masks Needed: Clarification to Sewing Fabric Masks

ProMedica is grateful to the tremendous response to help sew face masks. As a point of clarification, these masks are not for use during the direct care of a patient whose condition requires a mask. Instead, they will be used in general areas for patients, visitors and nonclinical staff. ProMedica wants to make them available to help keep all employees and our limited visitors safe. The community donation of these masks will enable us to provide masks for everyone in the general areas without depleting the hospital-acquired surgical masks that are needed for patients. All collected masks will be immediately sent to laundry/processing to be prepared for use. Surplus masks will be distributed to local organizations in need.

In accordance with the CDC recommendation, ProMedica is recommending that people wear homemade masks when in public. The general public should use homemade masks and reserve surgical masks and N95s for frontline healthcare workers, who are more at risk.

For details and sewing instructions, go to ProMedica HealthConnect

name: ProMedica Impact Fund Launches as Communities Prepare for PostCOVID19 Needs Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Impact Fund Launches as Communities Prepare for Post-COVID-19 Needs Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Impact Fund Launches as Communities Prepare for Post-COVID-19 Needs

Press Release
ProMedica Impact Fund Launches as Communities Prepare for Post-COVID-19 Needs

TOLEDO, Ohio, April 7, 2020 – ProMedica is announcing the launch of The ProMedica Impact Fund (PIF), a nationwide philanthropic approach to improving the health and well-being of individuals by accelerating efforts around the Social Determinants of Health (SDOH). The ProMedica Impact Fund will help address needs that were already critical in so many communities, and are now being intensified by the COVID-19 crisis.

“The need to create a new model of health and well-being has been known for years, and it’s clear that we need a new path that addresses public health, primary care, mental health and major investments in SDOH,” said Randy Oostra, ProMedica President and CEO. “It’s never been more critical than it is now to direct significantly more resources to people’s basic needs. Now is the time for a major social impact in our country.”

ProMedica will leverage 10 years of expertise in addressing the underlying social and environmental effects on health and collaborating with community-based organizations to address issues like hunger, affordable housing, workforce development and education.

“Our belief is that The ProMedica Impact Fund is the right response, at the right time, being built with the right collaboration between national philanthropy and expanded local programs,” said Mr. Oostra.

ProMedica has set a goal of raising $1 billion in the next eight years to support this ongoing work to transform the health of communities.

The PIF will invest in three categories of activities:
  • Grants to not-for-profit agencies whose interventions and outcomes are aligned with the SDOH model for improvement of individual and community health.
  • Creation and scaling of standardized national metrics and data-tracking to align organizations working on critical SDOH initiatives.
  • Seed capital in new businesses and/or agencies that are mission-aligned with the PIF goals.
This year, the PIF will launch in select U.S. cities, with the intention to quickly expand to other communities around the nation.

“ProMedica is a national health and well-being organization with a proven track record in advancing SDOH initiatives,” Mr. Oostra said. “We will forge new partnerships in philanthropy and local interventions to expedite how individuals and communities recover from the personal and economic impact of this disease.”

Learn more about how ProMedica is addressing the Social Determinants of Health.

name: ProMedica Announces Bay Park Hospital Labor  Delivery Unit Update Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces Bay Park Hospital Labor & Delivery Unit Update Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces Bay Park Hospital Labor & Delivery Unit Update

Press Release
ProMedica Announces Bay Park Hospital Labor & Delivery Unit Update

TOLEDO, Ohio, March 20, 2020 – As ProMedica continues to implement its plan to utilize ProMedica Bay Park Hospital as the system’s centralized facility for COVID-19 patients, it is transitioning certain units within the hospital to prepare for impending system patient care needs. One such transition relates to Bay Park’s labor and delivery unit, which will accommodate the system’s suspected/confirmed COVID-19 maternity patients that may deliver in the near future.

To that end, ProMedica is contacting all current patients who previously pre-registered to deliver at Bay Park in the coming weeks. The health system is working with those patients to identify options to deliver at another ProMedica hospital, specifically ProMedica Flower or ProMedica Memorial (Fremont) Hospitals, as well as ProMedica Toledo Hospital. These hospitals are within 20-30 minutes of Bay Park and offer outstanding clinical care and exceptional, family-centered experiences for mom and baby.

ProMedica is looking forward to caring for these expectant mothers and appreciates their understanding as we continue to navigate through the COVID-19 pandemic as a community.

Read more about ProMedica and COVID-19

name: ProMedica Cancels Nonessential Surgeries and Procedures Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Cancels Non-essential Surgeries and Procedures Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Cancels Non-essential Surgeries and Procedures

Press Release
ProMedica Cancels Non-essential Surgeries and Procedures

TOLEDO, Ohio, March 17, 2020 –Effective at 5 p.m. on March 18, 2020, all non-essential surgeries and procedures at all ProMedica facilities (Ohio and Michigan) will be cancelled until further notice. This is in compliance with Ohio Governor Mike DeWine’s executive orders to cease these types of surgeries/procedures in order to preserve the state’s supply of personal protective equipment (PPE) due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Emergency and/or time-sensitive surgeries and procedures will continue as needed or scheduled. If you have questions regarding an upcoming surgery or procedure, please contact your provider/surgeon directly for more information.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.

name: ProMedica Announces Updated Hours for Services and Locations Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces Updated Hours for Services and Locations Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces Updated Hours for Services and Locations

Press Release
ProMedica Announces Updated Hours for Services and Locations

TOLEDO, Ohio, March 17, 2020 – Please contact any ProMedica facility or provider to confirm the status of appointments prior to arrival.

To keep our patients, visitors and employees safe, many ProMedica services and locations are closing, or adjusting hours and processes. Below is a list that includes many locations that are currently closed or have implemented restrictions.

  • Audiology
    Services will be suspended effective March 23, 2020 through April 5, 2020. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.
  • ForeverFit
    Effective March 16, ProMedica ForeverFit fitness center is temporarily closed.
  • Infant Monitoring
    Home O2 re-qualification services will be suspended effective March 18, 2020 through April 5, 2020. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.
  • Health Information Management (Medical Records)
    Effective immediately, all of the Health Information Management (medical records) departments are closed to walk in customers. The department will be available by phone to assist customers during normal business hours 8 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. by calling 419-291-4172. Customers can also visit medical records for assistance. Chart pick up for discharge records will continue; however, it will be reduced to limit traffic in nursing units.
  • Hyperbaric Oxygen
    Emergent therapy (CO poisoning) will be provided. All other services will be suspended effective March 18, 2020 through April 5, 2020. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.
  • Lab
    Lab specimen collection services will continue during posted business hours. Planning is underway to consolidate patient collection sites.
  • Pulmonary Function, Pulmonary Rehab & Cardiac Rehab
    Services will be suspended effective March 18, 2020 through April 5, 2020. PF testing will be provided with the approval of the medical director. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.
  • Radiology
    The American College of Radiology fully supports and recommends compliance with Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidelines that advises medical facilities to reschedule non-urgent outpatient visits as necessary. We are complying with their guidance and will begin canceling arthrograms, routine fluoroscopy cases for GI, outpatient swallow studies, CT colonoscopy, musculoskeletal ultrasound, thyroid ultrasounds and ultrasound follow up for lesions (liver or kidney). This will be in addition to mammography screening, lung cancer screening and dexa appointments that are already suspended. Service will be suspended effective March 26, 2020 through April 5, 2020. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.
  • Sleep Lab
    Services will be suspended effective immediately through March 23, 2020. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before March 23, 2020.
  • Surgery
    Effective at 5 p.m. on March 18, 2020, all non-essential surgeries and procedures at all ProMedica facilities (Ohio and Michigan) will be cancelled until further notice.
  • Total Rehab
    Outpatient PT/OT services will be operating on a limited basis. Speech Therapy will be temporarily suspended with the exception of swallow studies, evaluating on case-by-case. Plan to consolidate clinics and reduce hours of operation based on patient volume. The plan is to assess the ability to resume services or continue with the suspended services on or before April 6, 2020.

Thank you for your understanding and patience during this time.

name: ProMedica Announces Temporary Changes to Help Keep Patients Employees and the Community Safe Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces Temporary Changes to Help Keep Patients, Employees and the Community Safe Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces Temporary Changes to Help Keep Patients, Employees and the Community Safe

Press Release
ProMedica Announces Temporary Changes to Help Keep Patients, Employees and the Community Safe

TOLEDO, Ohio, March 14, 2020 – In advance of COVID-19 cases being diagnosed in the regions it serves, ProMedica is implementing temporary changes to help protect our patients, employees and members of the community. Effective immediately and until further notice:

Visitor Restrictions - Hospital and Outpatient Surgery Facilities:

All ProMedica hospitals and outpatient surgery facilities are restricting all visitors. Some exceptions may apply and will be determined on a case-by-case basis. Those exceptions include:

  • Patients receiving end of life care may have visitors.
  • Pediatric patients may have two visitors who remain the same throughout the hospitalization.
  • Obstetrics (OB) patients may two visitors who remain the same throughout the hospitalization.
  • Patients whose health care team determines that visitors are essential to their well-being may have visitors.
  • Patients in ProMedica outpatient surgery facilities may have one visitor.

Update: Fever monitoring – For monitoring of fever in visitors, the temperature threshold has been changed to higher than 100.4 across all of our healthcare facilities.

Visitor Restrictions – Senior Care Facilities:

In accordance with the latest Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) guidelines, ProMedica has implemented the following visitor restrictions at its senior care facilities.

  • Restricting all visitors, volunteers and non-essential health care personnel except in certain compassionate care situations, such as end-of-life situations.
  • Notifying potential visitors to defer visitation until further notice.
  • Limiting facility access for the small number of visitors who will be permitted (only allowing them to visit the resident’s room or location designated by the care team).

The limited number of visitors who may be permitted in any ProMedica facility will be subject to daily screenings at each facilities’ designated entry point(s). To help ensure the safety of patients and employees, the screenings will check visitors for fever and respiratory illness symptoms.

Visitors exhibiting any of these symptoms will not be permitted to visit. Visitors who meet the visitor restriction guidelines and pass the screening will be identified with a visitor badge.

During this time of visitor restriction, friends and family members are encouraged to connect with their loved ones who are in our facilities using phone calls, email, texting, video chat or other electronic communications.

Postponing Non-Essential Patient Appointments:

ProMedica physicians will be temporarily postponing non-essential, non-urgent office visits, tests and procedures. The physicians will be using their discretion to determine which appointments they will be postponing. Any affected patients will be notified.

View all ProMedica COVID-19 Updates, including information about other visitor restrictions

name: A COVID message from ProMedicas President and CEO
Title: A COVID message from ProMedica's President and CEO
Description:
A message from ProMedica's President and CEO

Press Release
A message from ProMedica's President and CEO

March 13, 2020

Dear Community Member,

ProMedica is working around the clock to provide a clean, safe and compassionate care environment at every one of our medical facilities, physician offices, senior care facilities and hospitals. Over the past month, our coronavirus incident management team has been meeting and communicating daily with all local, CDC and WHO officials to ensure that we have a plan and resources in place should the new coronavirus come to this region. Our system is continuing to take aggressive steps to minimize the spread of the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19). We are here to provide the very best care to our patients, especially in challenging times when the sickest, weakest and most fragile need us the most. We take that responsibility seriously. If we need to reschedule your appointment or limit visitors to all our facilities in coming days and weeks, know that this is because we are trying to protect those in our care.

We realize that this is unprecedented for our community. We also know that rumors and social media can frequently increase anxiety and stress. We are working hard to communicate clearly and proactively. I am proud of our ProMedica employees and their commitment. At every level of our organization, our team is dedicated and focused on improving the health and well-being of the people we serve.

Sincerely,

 
 

Randy Oostra

Read more about ProMedica and COVID-19

name: Toledo Walleye Mascot Presents Check to ProMedica Cancer Institute
Title: Toledo Walleye Mascot Presents Check to ProMedica Cancer Institute
Description:
Toledo Walleye Mascot Presents Check to ProMedica Cancer Institute

Press Release
Toledo Walleye Mascot Presents Check to ProMedica Cancer Institute

The Toledo Walleye teamed up with ProMedica Cancer Institute through their Hockey Fights Cancer campaign this past November raising awareness and over $11,000. These funds will help support ProMedica Cancer Institute programs and services for cancer patients.

With the color purple representing all cancers, Walleye players wore special purple jerseys adorned with a Hockey Fights Cancer decal, which were auctioned live on ice following the game.

ProMedica Cancer Institute offers the Best Adult and Pediatric Cancer Care close to home. Our program provides access to vast network of experts, treatment and support services. We appreciate the opportunity to partner with the Walleye on this event to increase awareness of cancer and available care in our community,” said Ann Kujawa, vice president of ProMedica Cancer Institute.

Nationally recognized services are provided through ProMedica Cancer Institute, the largest cancer registry in the region, connecting patients to a vast network of experts, treatments and support services.

Hockey Fights Cancer is a league-wide initiative founded by the National Hockey League (NHL) and NHL Players' Association and is dedicated to raising awareness for national and local organizations involved in cancer care and research.

The check was presented at the Hickman Cancer Center by the Toledo Walleye Mascot.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Named One of Healthgrades 2020 Americas 50 Best Hospitals Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Named One of Healthgrades 2020 America's 50 Best Hospitals Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Named One of Healthgrades 2020 America's 50 Best Hospitals

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Named One of Healthgrades 2020 Americaâ€™s 50 Best Hospitals

ProMedica Toledo Hospital is pleased to announce that it has received the Healthgrades 2020 America’s 50 Best Hospitals Award™. The distinction places Toledo Hospital in the top one percent of more than 4,500 hospitals assessed nationwide for its consistent, year-over-year superior clinical performance as measured by Healthgrades, a national organization that analyzes the performance of hospitals across the country.

ProMedica continuously strives to build and maintain a culture of safety, clinical excellence and exceptional patient experiences. “When we live by our Mission and values, we create an environment that is centered around our patients," said Dawn Buskey, president of ProMedica Toledo and Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospitals. "As one of America's 50 Best Hospitals, we will continue to foster a safe, healing environment for our patients and communities, and create and implement best practices we can share with hospitals across the nation."

“The recipients of the Healthgrades America’s 50 Best Hospitals Award are committed to high quality standards throughout the entire organization,” said Brad Bowman, MD, Chief Medical Officer at Healthgrades. “We congratulate the recipients of this award as they provide the best care possible for their patients.”

From 2016 through 2018, patients treated in hospitals achieving the award had, on average, a 27.1 percent lower risk of dying than if they were treated in hospitals that did not receive the award, as measured across 19 rated conditions and procedures for which mortality is the outcome.*

During that same period, if all hospitals performed similarly to those achieving the Healthgrades America's 50 Best Hospitals Award, 188,768 lives could potentially have been saved. For example, patients treated for heart failure at a hospital that achieved the award had, on average, a 33.8 percent lower risk of dying during their hospital stay than if treated at a hospital that did not receive the award.*

Toledo Hospital also has been named one of Healthgrades 100 Best Hospitals for Cardiac Care, General Surgery, Joint Replacement, Pulmonary Care and Gastrointestinal Care.

Recipients of the Healthgrades America’s 50 Best Hospitals Award stand out among the rest for overall clinical excellence across a broad spectrum of care. During the 2020 study period (2016 through 2018), these hospitals showed superior performance in clinical outcomes for patients in the Medicare population across at least 21 of 32 most common inpatient conditions and procedures — as measured by objective performance data (risk-adjusted mortality and in-hospital complications).

To learn more about how Healthgrades determines award recipients, and for more information on Healthgrades Quality Solutions, please visit www.healthgrades.com/quality.

name: ProMedica Toledo Childrens Hospital Finalized Name Change to Russell J Ebeid Childrens Hospital and Completes Interior Renovations Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital Finalized Name Change to Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital and Completes Interior Renovations Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital Finalized Name Change to Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital and Completes Interior Renovations

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Childrenâ€™s Hospital Finalized Name Change to Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital and Completes Interior Renovations

ProMedica is pleased to announce that ProMedica Toledo Children’s Hospital has officially been renamed ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

The name change is in honor of Russell J. Ebeid and his family for their extensive generosity to ProMedica and for their compassion to help children.

Dawn Buskey, president of ProMedica Toledo and Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospitals said, “Philanthropist Russell J. Ebeid dedicated much of his life to helping others. We’re honored that our children’s hospital now carries his name in memory of his impact on community health. Mr. Ebeid’s generosity helped ProMedica establish Ebeid Hospice Residence, ProMedica Ebeid Institute and ProMedica Ebeid Neighborhood Promise.”

In addition to the name, significant renovations were made to the hospital to help bring a new era of pediatric care to Toledo.

The renovations include:
  • A new pediatric intensive care unit with 15 private rooms that provide plenty of space for patients, family members and caregivers. These rooms have pullout couches for parents to provide comfort and better sleeping conditions when they are with their children.
  • Updated, large pediatric acute care rooms.
  • Easier access to the helipad for pediatric critical care transfers.
  • A new pediatric inpatient gym that provides the space and equipment necessary for patients to rehabilitate.
  • An uplifting, child-friendly environment to promote healing.

“Our children’s hospital is committed to giving children the best possible care in a place that’s just for them. A dedicated pediatric emergency room, kid-friendly diagnostics and exceptional pediatric chronic care management are a few of the ways we put children and their families first. And, because we’re accredited by the Joint Commission, you know your child is in the best hands,” said Paula Grieb, chief nursing officer, ProMedica Metro Region.

name: ProMedica Opens First Adult Comprehensive Sickle Cell Clinic Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Opens First Adult Comprehensive Sickle Cell Clinic Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Opens First Adult Comprehensive Sickle Cell Clinic

Press Release
ProMedica Opens First Adult Comprehensive Sickle Cell Clinic

There is a new resource in northwest Ohio for people with sickle cell disease as ProMedica has opened the first adult sickle cell clinic. Sickle cell disease is a group of inherited red blood cell disorders, which often leads to serious health problems.

The Adult Sickle Cell Clinic provides comprehensive treatment including transfusions, pain management and exemplary care for adults.

ProMedica Toledo Children’s Hospital will continue to treat children for the disease.

Crawford Strunk, MD, pediatric hematologist and oncologist at Toledo Children’s Hospital, said there is a need for pediatric patients to transition to adult care smoothly. “It’s important to have a continuity of care as pediatric patients become adults. Their medical needs change and they are also glad to visit an adult office instead of a pediatric office in their 20s.”

Only a few adult sickle cell clinics exist nationally and they report reduced emergency center visits, hospitalizations, and a reduced rate of long-term complications. Dr. Strunk said, “Nationally, there are not a lot of medical providers with the experience or expertise to care for patients with sickle cell disease.”

The clinic is staffed by the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Medical Oncology Outpatient Infusion office, Dr. Strunk and Jobst Vascular physician, Drew Oostra, MD.

Dr. Oostra said, “We started this clinic to provide care for patients with sickle cell disease who do not currently have a medical provider for their disease or who feel that their care could be improved. We are also taking referrals from current providers who feel patients would benefit from a comprehensive care setting."

name: ProMedica Opens Health Clinics for Employees of Wood County Schools Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Opens Health Clinics for Employees of Wood County Schools Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Opens Health Clinics for Employees of Wood County Schools

Press Release
ProMedica Opens Health Clinics for Employees of Wood County Schools
TOLEDO, January 23, 2020 – ProMedica is pleased to announce the opening of two new health clinics for employees of Wood County Schools at 1180 N. Main St., Suite 5, Bowling Green, Ohio and 2751 Bay Park Drive, Suite 209, Oregon, Ohio. 

The ProMedica Physicians Wood County School Consortium Health Clinics are open six days a week, Monday through Saturday, with extended hours three days a week. About 4,000 plan members, which includes employees and their families, will be able to access the services at the health clinics.

Kent Bishop, MD, chief medical officer ProMedica physicians and acute care stated, “As healthcare adapts and changes, we need to think differently about how to manage the health and well-being of specific populations.” 

The clinics provide a wide array of additional services beyond a traditional primary care office. They include services such as wellness programs, routine testing and labs, nutrition counseling and medically integrated fitness programs.

“We first heard of such a program at a conference about four years ago. We’ve been working on bringing it to Wood County. It’s a great asset to employees, especially in rural regions. As superintendents, we desire to provide great services and have a healthy workforce,” said Adam Koch, superintendent, Otsego Local Schools.

The health clinics also have some potential cost-saving benefits compared to urgent care and emergency room visits. “We are always mindful of cost-savings initiatives. This is a win-win situation,” said Brent Welker, superintendent, Eastwood Local Schools.

Both superintendents have received positive feedback about the clinics from employees and their families. Welker stated, “My daughter used one of the clinics before she went back to college after winter break. The scheduling was easy and convenient and she was pleased with the experience.”

These health clinics exemplify ProMedica’s vision to create communities where all individuals reach their highest potential for health.

name: ProMedica Opens First Pediatric Urgent Care in Northwest Ohio Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Opens First Pediatric Urgent Care in Northwest Ohio Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Opens First Pediatric Urgent Care in Northwest Ohio

Press Release
ProMedica Opens First Pediatric Urgent Care in Northwest Ohio

Parents in northwest Ohio now have a new option when their children have a minor illness or injury that requires immediate attention. ProMedica Urgent Care for Kids opened in Perrysburg this month as the first and only urgent care in the region dedicated to exclusively treating children under the age of 18.

ProMedica Urgent Care for Kids is located across from Levis Commons in Perrysburg and features pediatric-trained providers and on-site lab and X-ray.

Jon Dvorak, MD, Director of Medical Operations, ProMedica Physician Group, said, “Consistent with our ongoing goal to improve the health and well-being of children and adolescents in northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan,  ProMedica has opened an Urgent Care fully dedicated to pediatrics. This Urgent Care will be staffed by specialty-trained certified pediatric nurse practitioners and physician assistants with extensive pediatric experience. These providers will have a close link with ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital emergency department in the case more extensive care is needed.”

Children may be seen at the new specialized Urgent Care location for a wide variety of common conditions including:

  • Ear and eye infections
  • Cold and influenza
  • Sprains, strains and fractures
  • Cuts and lacerations
  • Minor burns
  • Alergies
  • Sports and school physicals

ProMedica Urgent Care for Kids is open from 8 a.m. – 8 p.m. every day and is located at 25950 Dixie Hwy., Perrysburg. All major insurances and credit cards are accepted.

Learn More About ProMedica Urgent Care for Kids

Learn More

name: ProMedica Teen PEP Program Adapts to New Centers for Disease Control and Prevention CDC Requirements Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Teen PEP Program Adapts to New Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Requirements Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Teen PEP Program Adapts to New Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Requirements

Press Release
ProMedica Teen PEP Program Adapts to New Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Requirements

TOLEDO, Ohio, January 20, 2020– Teen Peers Educating Peers (Teen PEP), an outreach program at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital that focuses on youth violence prevention among teens, was again awarded a grant through the Ohio Department of Health. This grant cycle, beginning Feb. 1, will reflect new requirements issued by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

Established in 1995, Teen PEP focuses on sexual-violence prevention education as well as teen dating violence and bullying prevention. The project is based on the CDC-evaluated, evidence-based curriculum Expect Respect: A School-Based Program Promoting Safe and Healthy Relationships for Youth, and integrates concepts from Safe Dates. The goal of the program is to train students as teen leaders to reduce the incidence of sexual violence in northwest Ohio.

Danielle Cisterino-Hajdu, project director of the Teen PEP program said, “I’m proud to report that the Teen Pep program has some remarkable results. Statistically, 1 in 3 women and 1 in 4 men report being sexually assaulted between the ages of 11 and 17. Program participants demonstrate an increase of up to 60 percent in knowledge related to sexual assault prevention.”

The CDC is shifting the focus from lesson-driven activities to having the students develop policy and action plans for unsafe areas at schools. 

The program will now include more adult professional hospital and program staff to support and guide the youth-led services. These services will focus on awareness, education and action planning around unsafe zones in schools where bullying and other forms of harassment and/or violence might be taking place. Additionally, teens will lead the development of messaging campaigns to create healthy cultural norms for their peers.

Teen PEP experts will train youth leaders on how to be change agents in their community. Cisterino-Hajdu explains, “The Ohio Department of Health wants us to build strong relationships and be a presence in our partnering schools, working with select groups of youth leaders to form healthy cultural norms that help prevent sexual violence and teen dating violence specifically.”

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org/TeenPep.

name: ProMedica Acquires First DualPurpose Security Dog Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Acquires First Dual-Purpose Security Dog Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Acquires First Dual-Purpose Security Dog

Press Release
ProMedica Acquires First Dual-Purpose Security Dog

TOLEDO, Ohio, January 14, 2020 - ProMedica has recently implemented a canine program to provide its security team with another resource to enhance safety at ProMedica hospitals.

Jozef is a fully trained dual-purpose service dog whose primary role is to help keep patients, visitors and caregivers safe. He is specialty trained to perform building area searches, scent tracking, staff protection and firearms detection on command. He is also trained in pet therapy and will serve in a therapeutic role. As a loving, approachable canine, he will provide compassion to the people he encounters. He is the first canine to come on board, with plans to bring in two additional canines over the next two years.

Brad Conner, ProMedica administrative director of security, voice operations & disaster management, said, “Jozef was brought in as a preventative measure. He is a working dog who will respond to the commands of his handler, Officer Nick Buchan.  They will be seen walking the hallways throughout various ProMedica hospitals but will spend the majority of the time at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.  Jozef will not be a stranger in the ProMedica Toledo Children’s Hospital, where children can pet him, allowing him to help create a more comfortable environment for them.”

All patient visits are pre-scheduled and special care is taken when introducing the dog, including distributing collector cards with Jozef’s picture and information.

name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Mammography Accreditation by the American College of Radiology Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Mammography Accreditation by the American College of Radiology Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Mammography Accreditation by the American College of Radiology

Press Release
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Mammography Accreditation by the American College of Radiology

FOSTORIA, Ohio, January 6, 2020 – ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital has been awarded a three-year term of accreditation in mammography as the result of a recent review by the American College of Radiology (ACR). Mammography is a specific type of imaging test that uses a low-dose X-ray system to examine breasts. A mammography exam, called a mammogram, is used to aid in the early detection and diagnosis of breast diseases in women.

“Fostoria Community Hospital is proud to be an ACR accredited and trusted site for patients receiving radiology services such as mammography,” said Nathan Egbert, MD, medical director of radiology at Fostoria Community Hospital. “Providing the highest level of image quality and safety is a top priority, as we know mammograms are critical for an early detection of breast cancer.”

The ACR gold seal of accreditation represents the highest level of image quality and patient safety. It is awarded only to facilities meeting ACR Practice Parameters and Technical Standards after a peer-review evaluation by board-certified physicians and medical physicists who are experts in the field. Image quality, personnel qualifications, adequacy of facility equipment, quality control procedures and quality assurance programs are assessed. The findings are reported to the ACR Committee on Accreditation, which subsequently provides the practice with a comprehensive report that can be used for continuous practice improvement.

The ACR, founded in 1924, is a professional medical society dedicated to serving patients and society by empowering radiology professionals to advance the practice, science and professions of radiological care. The College serves more than 37,000 diagnostic/interventional radiologists, radiation oncologists, nuclear medicine physicians, and medical physicists with programs focusing on the practice of medical imaging and radiation oncology and the delivery of comprehensive health care services.

For more information about ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital, visit www.promedica.org/fostoria.

name: ProMedica Recognized by Beckers Healthcare as One of 100 Hospitals and Health Systems with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs in 2019 Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Recognized by Becker's Healthcare as One of 100 Hospitals and Health Systems with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs in 2019 Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Recognized by Becker's Healthcare as One of 100 Hospitals and Health Systems with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs in 2019

Press Release
ProMedica Recognized by Beckerâ€™s Healthcare as One of 100 Hospitals and Health Systems with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs in 2019

TOLEDO, Ohio, December 31, 2019 – ProMedica is pleased to announce it has been named to Becker's Healthcare 2019 list of 100 hospitals and health systems with great neurosurgery and spine programs.

The organizations featured on this year's list have extensive neurosurgery and spine programs, providing treatment and cutting edge research into brain and spine disorders. Many hospitals and health systems featured have earned top honors for medical excellence, outcomes and patient experience in their spine and brain surgery departments.

ProMedica’s Neurosciences Institute provides the latest neurosurgery technologies, treatments, resources and experts for patient care. This center of excellence delivers best-in-class neurosurgery care with an experienced team of neurosurgeons that brings a long-standing history of quality care and expertise in the diagnosis and surgical treatment of brain and spine conditions. The institute recently launched ProMedica Spine Care with the ProMedica Orthopaedic Institute to provide immediate access for patients suffering with back or neck pain and ensures accurate triage when it is most needed.

For more information about ProMedica’s Neurosciences Institute, visit www.promedica.org/neurosciences.

name: ProMedica President and CEO Recognized as One of the 100 Most Influential People by Modern Healthcare Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica President and CEO Recognized as One of the 100 Most Influential People by Modern Healthcare Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica President and CEO Recognized as One of the 100 Most Influential People by Modern Healthcare

Press Release
ProMedica President and CEO Recognized as One of the 100 Most Influential People by Modern Healthcare

TOLEDO, Ohio, December 10, 2019 – ProMedica is proud to announce its President and CEO Randy Oostra has been recognized by Modern Healthcare as one of the 100 Most Influential People of 2019. This is the third consecutive year Mr. Oostra has been recognized by Modern Healthcare in this capacity.

The prestigious recognition program acknowledges and honors individuals who are deemed by their peers and the senior editors of Modern Healthcare to be the most influential in the industry, in terms of leadership and impact.

“This year’s selection process was contentious and difficult. Many healthcare organizations made bold strides in the continued transformation of the industry. Many others were more cautious during a year that brought uncertainty over how the law of the land might change as a result of a federal court decision,” commented Aurora Aguilar, Modern Healthcare editor. “The honorees chosen this year by Modern Healthcare and our readers are those who were fearless in their risky strategies and unapologetic in their rationale. Whether you agree with the compiled list or not, you can’t argue with the influence of these 100 healthcare leaders. Congratulations to those honorees.”

“It’s an honor to be recognized as one of Modern Healthcare’s 100 most influential people,” said Randy Oostra, president and CEO, ProMedica. “This past year, the ProMedica team has continued its transformation by exploring several new opportunities that have come about through our nontraditional partnership with HCR ManorCare. These opportunities are helping ProMedica to redefine the role of health care in healthy aging and to expand our social determinants work – necessary steps to meet the future demands of health care.”

To view the complete list, visit ModernHealthcare.com/100MostInfluential.

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.

name: Pediatric Eye Care
Title: Pediatric Eye Care
Description:
ProMedica Physicians Welcomes New Pediatric Ophthalmologist

Press Release
ProMedica Physicians Welcomes New Pediatric Ophthalmologist

TOLEDO, Ohio, December 2, 2019 - ProMedica Physicians is proud to welcome Michelle Ariss, MD to ProMedica Physicians Eye Care, located at 5700 Monroe Street, Sylvania, OH 43560.

Born and raised in Toledo, Dr. Ariss is a pediatric ophthalmologist who specializes in the medical and surgical treatment of childhood ocular disorders for children of all ages, including newborns. For many years she practiced at Children’s Mercy Hospital in Kansas City, but has since returned to continue treating pediatric patients in her hometown.

While Dr. Ariss provides comprehensive pediatric eye care, her surgical expertise includes strabismus surgery for misaligned eyes, nasolacrimal duct surgery, and eyelid lesions.

Dr. Ariss received her medical degree from Medical College of Ohio in Toledo, Ohio and completed her residency at the Freindenwald Eye Institute in Baltimore, Maryland. She also completed a fellowship in pediatric ophthalmology and strabismus at the Cole Eye Institute in Cleveland, Ohio.

To schedule an appointment, call 419-776-1004. For more information about eye care at ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org/eyecare.

Call 419-776-1004 to schedule today.

Learn more about eye care at ProMedica

name: ProMedica Announces Commitment to Social Determinants of Health through Data Nerve Center and Investment in Data Analytics Partner Socially Determined Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces Commitment to Social Determinants of Health through Data Nerve Center and Investment in Data Analytics Partner, Socially Determined Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces Commitment to Social Determinants of Health through Data Nerve Center and Investment in Data Analytics Partner, Socially Determined

Press Release
ProMedica Announces Commitment to Social Determinants of Health through Data Nerve Center and Investment in Data Analytics Partner, Socially Determined

SDOH Investment Will Target Impact on Health Outcomes and Cost Reduction

TOLEDO, Ohio, December 3, 2019 – ProMedica National Social Determinants of Health Institute today announced the creation of the Ebeid Data Nerve Center and partnership with Socially Determined, a health care data analytics company.

As health care increasingly focuses on addressing the social determinants of health (SDOH), it is essential to use applied data analytics and predictive modeling to both identify patients, members and employees in greatest need and to determine efficient and effective interventions that improve their health outcomes and reduce the cost of their care.

By integrating ProMedica’s clinical excellence and deep data structures with Socially Determined’s powerful analytic capabilities, the Ebeid Data Nerve Center will focus on the needs of specific patient cohorts that could benefit from standardized interventions designed to improve health care outcomes. By applying data-informed workflows into front-end clinical settings, the initiative will disrupt traditional structures of population health management and create a new, innovative model of precision population health, leading to improved health and well-being for ProMedica patients and a reduction in overall cost.

ProMedica’s Ebeid Data Nerve Center will be the centerpiece of this initiative, focused on evaluating and understanding the connection between social and economic factors and health. The center will serve as a:

  • Powerful demonstration of ProMedica’s commitment to Toledo and the impact of SDOH on our community
  • Centralized analytic driver for the Institute, dynamically integrating data sources and intervention resources, while bringing visibility to strategy and operations
  • "Single Pane of Glass" through which ProMedica can unify research, analysis, and operational excellence around SDOH
  • Cutting-edge venue for on-site visits, speaking engagements and events
As a further commitment to the success of this initiative, ProMedica has joined four other organizations in supporting Series 'A' funding of $7.3 million for Socially Determined, a leading provider of SDOH data analytics

Addressing the social determinants of health is one of the leading disruptions in health care, and we must begin to use data analytics to drive the innovation and quantify impact,” said Randy Oostra, President and CEO, ProMedica. “Socially Determined links clinical, claims and community data to allow for meaningful action and to support reimbursement for interventions, such as food, housing and transportation.”

ProMedica is a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization headquartered in Toledo, Ohio. It serves communities in 28 states. The organization offers acute and ambulatory care, an insurance company with a dental plan, and post-acute and academic business lines. The organization has more than 56,000 employees, 13 hospitals, 2,100+ physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, 900+ healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians, a health plan, and nearly 400 assisted living facilities, skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, and hospice and home health care agencies. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

About Socially Determined

Socially Determined is a Washington, DC-based healthcare technology and analytics startup focused on measuring the impact of the social determinants of health. SocialScapeTM is the industry’s first analytics platform to quantify and visualize social risk using the largest curated repository of SDOH data in the nation. The technology is supported by a team of experts who provide SDOH program evaluation and measurement, offer deep cohort analysis, and guide clients through analytic insights to grow their lines of business into new geographies and risk arrangements. Learn more about Socially Determined at www.SociallyDetermined.com.

name: Press Ganey Awards ProMedica Leader Physician of the Year Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: Press Ganey Awards ProMedica Leader 'Physician of the Year' Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
Press Ganey Awards ProMedica Leader 'Physician of the Year'

Press Release
Press Ganey Awards ProMedica Leader â€˜Physician of the Yearâ€™

TOLEDO, Ohio, November 19, 2019 – ProMedica is proud to announce Brian Kaminski, DO, vice president, quality and patient safety, ProMedica, was the recipient of Press Ganey’s Physician of the Year award. The Press Ganey® Physician of the Year award recognizes a physician who demonstrates exceptional leadership and has reached tangible success by improving the patient experience, reducing patient and caregiver suffering, and promoting compassionate, connected care in his or her organization.

Press Ganey recognized Dr. Kaminski for his passion and commitment to improving the safety and experience of patient care every day. Dr. Kaminski works tirelessly with patients, families and colleagues to provide education, guidance, and support for managing pain in a responsible and safe manner. He also has spearheaded a redesigned safety culture at ProMedica that has created a unified strategy and resulted in the adoption of High Reliability standards across the care continuum.

"I am extremely honored and humbled by this recognition. Receiving this award is a testament to the great work being done by ProMedica's quality and safety team, and it positions ProMedica among the nation's leaders in organizational reliability,” said Dr. Kaminski. “I am thankful for the latitude and privilege that ProMedica and Emergency Physicians of Northwest Ohio have given me to pursue the mission of patient safety for our community of patients. Also, I am pleased that Press Ganey has chosen to elevate patient safety as a vital component of the patient experience. By choosing me, Press Ganey is declaring that healthcare organizations that prioritize patient safety through fair and just principles will develop the necessary organizational learning to create the best possible patient experiences and positive outcomes."

“ProMedica is fortunate to have someone as talented, passionate and committed to improving patient safety as Dr. Kaminski, on our team,” said Kevin Webb, president, provider, acute and ambulatory care, ProMedica.

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.

Description:
ProMedica Urgent Care First in Northwest Ohio to Earn Accreditation from the Urgent Care Association

Press Release
ProMedica Urgent Care First in Northwest Ohio to Earn Accreditation from the Urgent Care Association

TOLEDO, Ohio, October 29, 2019 – ProMedica Urgent Care is proud to announce it has achieved accreditation through the Urgent Care Association (UCA), the highest level of distinction for urgent care centers. It is the first urgent care organization in northwest Ohio to earn the recognition.

ProMedica Urgent Care’s seven centers provide patients with walk-in, extended-hour medical attention for a large scope of medical conditions. As part of the accreditation, the centers have met all of the Urgent Care Association’s established standards and criteria for quality of patient care, safety, and scope of services.

When a patient’s regular doctor cannot address a medical condition promptly – such as unexpected cuts, sprains or fractures that do not require a visit to the emergency department, ProMedica Urgent Care’s centers provide a convenient and viable treatment option. The centers are all equipped with x-ray, laboratory services, and licensed providers who are always available to perform minor procedures like splinting and suturing.

Urgent care fills the gap between primary care and hospital emergency rooms, offering increased convenience and cost savings. By participating in the accreditation process, ProMedica Urgent Care and the Urgent Care Association demonstrate their commitment toward providing patients with access to quality care of the highest level.

ProMedica Urgent Care accepts unscheduled, walk-in patients 8 a.m. – 8 p.m., 365 days a year.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital First in Region to Offer Innovative TCAR Procedure to Treat Carotid Artery Disease Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital First in Region to Offer Innovative TCAR Procedure to Treat Carotid Artery Disease Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital First in Region to Offer Innovative TCAR Procedure to Treat Carotid Artery Disease

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital First in Region to Offer Innovative TCAR Procedure to Treat Carotid Artery Disease

TOLEDO, Ohio, October 21, 2019 – Jobst Vascular Institute at ProMedica Toledo Hospital is the first in the region to treat carotid artery disease and prevent future strokes using a new procedure called Trans Carotid Artery Revascularization (TCAR). TCAR is a clinically proven, minimally invasive approach for high surgical risk patients who need carotid artery treatment.

Carotid artery disease is a form of atherosclerosis, or a buildup of plaque, in the two main arteries in the neck that supply oxygen-rich blood to the brain. If left untreated, carotid artery disease can often lead to stroke; it is estimated to be the source of stroke in up to a third of cases, with 400,000 new diagnoses of the disease made every year in the U.S. alone.

“TCAR is an important new option in the fight against stroke, and is particularly suited for the large portion of patients we see who are at higher risk of complications from carotid surgery due to age, anatomy, or other medical conditions,” said Sophie Afridi, MD, ProMedica Physicians Vascular Surgeon. “Because of its low stroke risk and faster patient recovery, I believe TCAR represents the future of carotid repair.”

TCAR is unique in that blood flow is temporarily reversed during the procedure so that any small bits of plaque that may break off are diverted away from the brain, preventing a stroke from happening. A small incision in the neck is done to limit the pathway the wire has to travel, minimizing the risk of stroke. A stent is then placed inside the artery to stabilize the plaque.

Prior to TCAR, the main treatment option for severe carotid artery disease was an open surgical procedure called carotid endarterectomy (CEA). CEA removes plaque from inside the carotid artery to restore normal blood flow to the brain, but the large incision leaves a visible scar the length of the neck and carries risks of surgical complications that can cause issues with swallowing, speaking and sensation in the face.

Press Release
Paramount Elite Medicare expands to Dayton

DAYTON, Ohio, Oct. 10, 2019 – New Medicare plan options will be offered to Dayton-area Medicare beneficiaries for the 2020 Annual Election Period (AEP), announced Paramount Health Care, an Ohio owned-and-operated health insurance company headquartered in Maumee, Ohio. The new plans will be available in Auglaize, Miami, Montgomery and Shelby counties. AEP begins Oct. 15, 2019, and ends Dec. 7, 2019.

“We are excited to bring our more than 25 years of Medicare expertise to Dayton. Because we are part of ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit health system, we provide a different approach to keeping our members healthy and thriving.
