name: ProMedica Flower Hospital Recognized by the American Heart Association for Stroke Care Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Flower Hospital Recognized by the American Heart Association for Stroke Care Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Flower Hospital Recognized by the American Heart Association for Stroke Care

Press Release
ProMedica Flower Hospital Recognized by the American Heart Association for Stroke Care

SYLVANIA, Ohio, July 22, 2019 – ProMedica Flower Hospital, a division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital, is proud to receive the American Heart Association’s Get With The Guidelines Stroke Gold Plus award. The award recognizes the hospital’s commitment to ensuring stroke patients receive the most appropriate treatment according to nationally recognized, research-based guidelines based on the latest scientific evidence.

Flower Hospital earned the award by meeting specific quality achievement measures for the diagnosis and treatment of stroke patients at a set level for a designated period. These measures include evaluation of the proper use of medications and other stroke treatments aligned with the most up-to-date, evidence-based guidelines with the goal of speeding recovery and reducing death and disability for stroke patients. Before discharge, patients should also receive education on managing their health, get a follow-up visit scheduled, as well as other care transition interventions.

Additionally, Flower Hospital received the association’s Target: Stroke Honor Roll Elite Plus award. This award recognizes ProMedica Flower Hospital for applying the most updated evidence-based treatment guidelines for improving patient care in the community, as well as showing consistent compliance with quality measures. Flower Hospital has also had The Joint Commission qualification of Primary Stroke Center since 2010.

“With stroke being the fifth leading cause of death in the United States and the leading cause of adult disability, it’s imperative that we’re providing the highest quality stroke care here in the community,” says Neeraj Kanwal, MD, interim president, ProMedica Metro Region Acute Care. “To be recognized by the American Heart Association for our efforts makes us really proud. Our efforts at Flower Hospital dovetail nicely with Toledo Hospital serving as a Joint Commission accredited Comprehensive Stroke Center.”

To qualify for this recognition, hospitals must meet quality measures developed to reduce the time between the patient’s arrival at the hospital and treatment with the clot-buster tissue plasminogen activator, or tPA, the only drug approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to treat ischemic stroke.

Description:

Press Release
ProMedica Gift Supports Convention Center Redevelopment

TOLEDO, Ohio, July 15, 2019 – ProMedica, a not-for-profit, mission-based health and well-being organization, today announced a commitment for a gift to the Toledo-Lucas County Convention and Visitor’s Bureau to support the planned redevelopment of the current SeaGate Convention Centre and ballroom addition.

The lead gift from ProMedica is $5 million, which will be submitted in installments of $333,333 annually over 15 years. “As an anchor institution in Toledo, we think it’s important to continue to support projects that help our community thrive -- especially since thriving communities support overall health and well-being,” said Robin Whitney, Chief Strategic Planning, Business Development and Real Estate Officer, ProMedica. “The updated convention center is expected to significantly boost the economic impact from visitors and have a meaningful impact on the community as a whole. We are proud to be among those organizations helping to support this important project,” Whitney added.

In conjunction with the gift, the Toledo-Lucas County Convention and Visitor’s Bureau has granted ProMedica the exclusive right to name the convention center. As of yet, ProMedica has not decided upon a name, but the new name will be announced by the end of the year.

Construction on the convention center and ballroom is expected to begin in spring 2020 and be completed in the first half of 2021.

name: ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Awarded Ohio Hospital Associations Donald R Newkirk Award Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Awarded Ohio Hospital Association's Donald R. Newkirk Award Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Awarded Ohio Hospital Association's Donald R. Newkirk Award

Press Release
ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Awarded Ohio Hospital Associationâ€™s Donald R. Newkirk Award

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 17, 2019 – ProMedica is pleased to announce Randy Oostra, President and CEO, ProMedica, has been awarded the Donald R. Newkirk Award by Ohio Hospital Association (OHA). The award recognizes and honors individuals who have made a significant lifetime contribution to the health care field in Ohio and bears the name of the individual who led OHA for 27 years.

Mr. Oostra has been with ProMedica for over 20 years and has worked in health care throughout his nearly 40-year career. He is regarded as one of the nation’s top leaders in health care and has earned a spot on several prestigious listings, which include Modern Healthcare’s 100 Most Influential People in Healthcare and Becker's Hospital Review’s 100 Great Leaders in Healthcare. He also received American Heart Association’s Pulse of Toledo Award in 2018 and the AHA Grassroots Champion Award (Ohio) in 2015.

Mr. Oostra has been recognized nationally for his focus on the social determinants of health, with a particular emphasis on hunger, shelter, and education. He is also known for his strong commitment to the health care industry and community and serves on the boards of a number of local and national organizations.

“Randy is a tremendous leader and strong advocate for health care and hospitals,” said Mike Abrams, president and CEO, OHA. “His commitment to patients and community inspires us to be stronger stewards of health care and we are proud to honor his accomplishments and achievements.”

The Ohio Hospital Association, representing Ohio’s 237 hospitals and 13 health systems, will present its top leadership award to Mr. Oostra for his 40 years of leadership and contributions to health care during OHA’s 2019 Annual Meeting Recognition Dinner event on Tuesday, June 4, 2019.

name: ProMedica Announces New Chief Financial Officer Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces New Chief Financial Officer Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces New Chief Financial Officer

Press Release
ProMedica Announces New Chief Financial Officer

TOLEDO, Ohio, May 16, 2019 – ProMedica, a not-for-profit, mission-based health and well-being organization, today announced Steve Cavanaugh has been appointed as chief financial officer (CFO) of ProMedica to succeed Mike Browning, effective June 3, 2019.

Serving 26 years in the healthcare industry, Mr. Cavanaugh will bring a wealth of experience to the ProMedica system CFO role. Since ProMedica’s acquisition of HCR ManorCare in July 2018, he has served as president of ProMedica’s HCR ManorCare division. Prior to the acquisition, he held several executive roles at HCR ManorCare over the years, including president and chief executive officer, chief operating officer, and chief financial officer. As the former CFO of a publicly traded, multi-billion-dollar company, Mr. Cavanaugh is well versed in providing strategic oversight for accounting, financial services, tax, treasury, internal auditing, reimbursement, purchasing and investor relations.

“Steve is a talented, accomplished leader who embraces and champions ProMedica’s bold vision for the future of health care,” said Randy Oostra, president and CEO of ProMedica. “Given the expertise and experience he will bring to the finance function, the CFO role and the entire ProMedica system, I am highly confident this will be a seamless transition that allows us to continue our momentum.”

In a related move, David Parker, current chief operating officer for ProMedica’s HCR ManorCare division, is being promoted to president of HCR ManorCare. Mr. Parker has held several leadership roles over the past 25 years at HCR ManorCare, and his experience and results-oriented focus make him the ideal choice to lead HCR ManorCare.

name: ProMedica Offers New Cutting Edge Robotic Exoskeleton Technology to Accelerate Mobility in Stroke Patients Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Offers New, Cutting Edge Robotic Exoskeleton Technology to Accelerate Mobility in Stroke Patients Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Offers New, Cutting Edge Robotic Exoskeleton Technology to Accelerate Mobility in Stroke Patients

Press Release
ProMedica Offers New, Cutting Edge Robotic Exoskeleton Technology to Accelerate Mobility in Stroke Patients

TOLEDO, Ohio, April 15, 2019 – ProMedica is pleased to announce today that it has enhanced its rehabilitation program by offering the EksoGT™ robotic exoskeleton, the first exoskeleton indicated for stroke and spinal cord injury rehabilitation. The wearable device augments strength to help patients stand and relearn to walk, while gaining confidence and freedom. The device is used to mobilize patients earlier in their rehabilitation, for optimal outcomes. The EksoGT will be available for inpatient care at ProMedica Flower Hospital’s Rehabilitation Center and outpatient care at Total Rehab in the Neurosciences Center on the campus of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. ProMedica is the first in Northwest Ohio to utilize this device.

Each year, as many as 500,000 individuals experience a spinal cord injury and 15 million suffer a stroke. This cutting-edge exoskeleton technology helps patient get back on their feet earlier to re-learn correct step patterns, weight shifting and posture. Clinical evidence suggests that including EksoGT gait training in inpatient rehabilitation for stroke improves independence in functional mobility. Most patients take an average of 400 steps their first-time training in the device. It is the most clinically used exoskeleton and patients around the world have taken over 100 million steps and counting.

“The EksoGT offers many unique benefits to our patients who are relearning to walk after a stroke. The device promotes early mobilization and can help improve gait speed and distance, which are critical factors for optimal recovery,” said Mouhammad Jumaa, MD, medical director, ProMedica Stroke Network.

EksoGT, manufactured by Ekso Bionics®, is a wearable robotic exoskeleton that helps patients with stroke and spinal cord injury stand and relearn to walk in a rehabilitation setting. Its SmartAssist™ software allows clinicians to augment a patient’s strength by customizing support for each leg independently, engaging the patient throughout their continuum of care.

“We are excited to provide our patients with access to this leading exoskeleton technology and are proud to be at the forefront of a new standard of care for stroke survivors,” says Linda Chambers, associate vice president of rehabilitation services, ProMedica.

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.

ProMedica is a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization headquartered in Toledo, Ohio. It serves communities in 28 states. The organization offers acute and ambulatory care, an insurance company with a dental plan, and post-acute and academic business lines. The organization has more than 56,000 employees, 13 hospitals, 2,100+ physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, 900+ healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians, a health plan, and nearly 400 assisted living facilities, skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, and hospice and home health care agencies. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

About EksoGT™

EksoGT™ is the first exoskeleton approved by the FDA for use with stroke and spinal cord injuries from L5 to C7. The EksoGT™ with SmartAssist™ software is the only exoskeleton available for rehabilitation institutions that can provide adaptive amounts of power to either side of a patient’s body, challenging the patient as they progress through their continuum of care. The suit’s patented technology provides the ability to mobilize patients earlier, more frequently, and with a greater number of high intensity steps. To date, this device has helped patients take more than 100 million steps in over 260 rehabilitation institutions around the world.

About Ekso Bionics®

Ekso Bionics® is a leading developer of exoskeleton solutions that amplify human potential by supporting or enhancing strength, endurance and mobility across medical and industrial applications. Founded in 2005, the company continues to build upon its unparalleled expertise to design some of the most cutting-edge, innovative wearable robots available on the market. Ekso Bionics is the only exoskeleton company to offer technologies that range from helping those with paralysis to stand up and walk, to enhancing human capabilities on job sites across the globe. The company is headquartered in the Bay Area and is listed on the Nasdaq Capital Market under the symbol EKSO. For more information, visit: www.globenewswire.com or follow us on Twitter: @EksoBionics.

name: ProMedica Announces New Chief Human Resources Officer Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Announces New Chief Human Resources Officer Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Announces New Chief Human Resources Officer

Press Release
ProMedica Announces New Chief Human Resources Officer

TOLEDO, Ohio, April 8, 2019 – ProMedica, a not-for-profit, mission-based health and well-being organization, today welcomed Les Thompson as the new Chief Human Resources Officer.

Mr. Thompson has more than 20 years of professional experience in human resources, operations, and mergers and acquisitions strategy and execution, along with international experience, including living and working in Shanghai, China. Most recently, he served as Vice President, Human Resources at Grainger, a Fortune 500 distributor of maintenance, repair and operating (MRO) supplies, headquartered in Lake Forest, Illinois, with global operations and customers. Prior to his role at Grainger, his career included a variety of progressive human resources leadership roles at Owens Corning in Toledo, Ohio.

As Chief Human Resources Officer at ProMedica, Mr. Thompson will serve as a vital resource and strategic business partner to leadership on matters related to culture, workplace environment, diversity and inclusion, strategic human capital decision-making, organizational effectiveness, succession planning, and the installation of human resources practices, structures, and programs that enable peak individual and organizational performance.

Mr. Thompson also will have accountability for all human resource management functions, including talent acquisition, employee and labor relations, organizational and leadership development, recognition and rewards, compensation, human resources information systems, benefits and pension administration, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion.

“After an extensive and thoughtful executive search, we are pleased to welcome Les to the ProMedica leadership team,” said Karen Strauss, Chief Administrative Officer at ProMedica. “With a strong track record of executive human resources successes, Les has the expertise necessary to evolve our talent and culture strategy and to help to ensure that ProMedica remains a top workplace of choice.”

name: ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Wins Jefferson Award Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Wins Jefferson Award Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Wins Jefferson Award

Press Release
ProMedica CEO Randy Oostra Wins Jefferson Award
TOLEDO, Ohio, April 4, 2019 - ProMedica is proud to announce Randy Oostra, President and CEO, ProMedica, has been honored with a local Jefferson Award for his strong commitment and positive contributions to the community. Mr. Oostra also has been chosen by the national Board of Selectors as the local winner to represent Toledo at the Jefferson Awards national ceremony in Washington D.C. in June 2019.
 
As President and CEO of ProMedica since 2008, Mr. Oostra is known for challenging the status quo of traditional health care. Believing that healthier people create healthier communities, he has driven corporate and personal responsibility within ProMedica to support decisions and investments that are aligned with the betterment of the entire community.
 
Mr. Oostra was one of the first healthcare leaders in the nation to acknowledge and embrace the need for the healthcare industry to look beyond the walls of hospitals and physicians’ offices to address the social determinants of health (SDOH). Understanding that the conditions in which people are born, live, work and play impact about 80 percent of a person’s health and well-being, he led the development of a comprehensive SDOH risk identification and intervention model that has touched the lives of more than two million ProMedica patients since 2014.
 
Additionally, Mr. Oostra has been instrumental in the movement to redevelop and revitalize Toledo’s downtown core. Bringing together like-minded business and civic leaders from around the region, he played a major role in the creation of the 22nd Century Committee, now ConnecToledo, which is a cross-sector group that provides leadership and drive the development of a strategic plan for downtown Toledo’s future identity.
 
The Jefferson Awards were founded in 1972 by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, Senator Robert Taft Jr., and Sam Beard as a national awards platform focused on extraordinary achievement in public service. For nearly 50 years, The Jefferson Awards have consistently celebrated, elevated and recognized individuals who build better communities and contribute to better a future for those around them.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital with The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences Offer Newly FDA Approved Treatment Device for Brain Aneurysms Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital with The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences Offer Newly FDA Approved Treatment Device for Brain Aneurysms Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital with The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences Offer Newly FDA Approved Treatment Device for Brain Aneurysms

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital with The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences Offer Newly FDA Approved Treatment Device for Brain Aneurysms

New device shortens procedure time in treating endovascular aneurysms compared to alternative therapies

TOLEDO, Ohio, April 3, 2019 – ProMedica Toledo Hospital and The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences (UTCoM) is pleased to offer a new cutting edge treatment for brain aneurysms, called the Woven EndoBridge (WEB) Aneurysm Embolization System. Recently gaining FDA approval, the WEB device is used to treat wide neck bifurcation aneurysms in certain areas of the brain.

A brain aneurysm is an abnormal bulging or ballooning of a blood vessel in the brain called an artery. An estimated six million people in the United States have an unruptured brain aneurysm. 

The device is made from ultra-fine wires braided together to form a flexible self-expanding mesh. When placed inside the aneurysm sac, the WEB device’s proprietary microbraid technology disrupts blood flow to treat challenging aneurysms that often require multiple implants with a single device. Additional benefits include:

  • Avoids stent placement in the brain's arterial system.
  • Provides an alternative therapy to open brain surgery for those previously unable to be treated minimally invasively.
  • May reduce medication required post-procedure.

“This new device is a game changer for patients with complex brain aneurysms. Prior to this major advent in endovascular therapy, treatment was far more risky and difficult for those patients,” says Syed Zaidi, MD, Medical Director, Interventional Neurology Program, ProMedica Toledo Hospital. “Together with The University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo Hospital has become a leading site for aneurysm treatment.”

Since it’s launch in March, NeuroEndovasular Surgeons and assistant professors of neurology at UTCoM, Drs. Mouhammad Jumaa, Syed Zaidi and Richard Burgess, have performed six successful procedures with this device. Toledo Hospital is the first comprehensive stroke center to offer this new treatment modality in Northern Ohio and Michigan.

Watch Dr. Zaidi explain how the device works in the video below with WTOL:

name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Tomography Accreditation
Title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Tomography Accreditation
Description:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Tomography Accreditation

Press Release
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Earns Tomography Accreditation

ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital has been awarded a three-year term of accreditation in computed tomography (CT) as the result of a recent review by the American College of Radiology (ACR). CT scanning — sometimes called CAT scanning — is a noninvasive medical test that helps physicians diagnose and tailor treatments for various medical conditions.

The ACR gold seal of accreditation represents the highest level of image quality and patient safety. It is awarded only to facilities meeting ACR Practice Parameters and Technical Standards after a peer-review evaluation by board-certified physicians and medical physicists who are experts in the field. Image quality, personnel qualifications, adequacy of facility equipment, quality control procedures and quality assurance programs are assessed. The findings are reported to the ACR Committee on Accreditation, which subsequently provides the practice with a comprehensive report that can be used for continuous practice improvement.

"Receiving this accreditation is an example of the high quality care provided to patients receiving radiology services here at Fostoria Community Hospital," said Nathan Perkins, director of radiology at Fostoria Community Hospital. "We strive for excellence, and we're pleased to be accredited by the ACR."

The ACR, founded in 1924, is a professional medical society dedicated to serving patients and society by empowering radiology professionals to advance the practice, science and professions of radiological care. The College serves more than 37,000 diagnostic/interventional radiologists, radiation oncologists, nuclear medicine physicians, and medical physicists with programs focusing on the practice of medical imaging and radiation oncology and the delivery of comprehensive health care services.

name: ProMedica Brings NGK Formula 1 Powerboat Championship Races to the Maumee River at Rock the River Toledo Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Brings NGK Formula 1 Powerboat Championship Races to the Maumee River at 'Rock the River Toledo Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Brings NGK Formula 1 Powerboat Championship Races to the Maumee River at 'Rock the River Toledo

Press Release
ProMedica Brings NGK Formula 1 Powerboat Championship Races to the Maumee River at â€˜Rock the River Toledo

TOLEDO, Ohio, March 12, 2019 – ProMedica and the United Power Boat Performance Group is pleased to bring powerboat performance racers back to Toledo. Rock the River Toledo is part of the NGK Spark Plugs Formula One (F1) Powerboat Championship.

Rock the River Toledo, sponsored by iHeartRadio, will bring world-class F1 powerboat racers to the Maumee River at Promenade Park on Saturday, June 29, 2019 for their 2nd stop of the 6-series racing championship that airs on CBS Sports.

Race fans will be entertained by the F1 boats lightning quick speeds of 120 mph and razor sharp turns, creating nonstop challenges for the world-class drivers. The up close and personal, deck to deck competition creates thrills rarely experienced by boat racing fans. Opening ceremonies will kick off at 3 p.m. in Promenade Park and are free to the public. There will be heat races leading up to the final, along with live bands, vendors, free race pit access, driver autograph sessions, dart boats and other displays.

“ProMedica is really excited that powerboat performance fans will get to experience a thrilling race right here in downtown Toledo along the Maumee River,” said Kathleen Merrill, vice president of Marketing Communications at ProMedica.

Defending 2004 F1 Powerboat Toledo race winner and Mercury Racing sponsored NGK F1 Powerboat Driver, Chris Fairchild, will return to Toledo at Rock the River to reclaim the fastest man on the Maumee title. “It’s been almost 15 years since we last raced in Toledo and had the honor of winning. I’m excited about coming back and getting back on top of the podium. What ProMedica and the City of Toledo has done to the riverfront since I raced here in 2004 is amazing and just makes our job easier to put on a great show. I know myself and the racers are excited to fly around the Maumee River at 120 mph and put on the most exciting race on water,” said Fairchild. 

For more information about the event, visit the event’s Facebook page or www.ngkf1.com.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Shines in CMS Hospital Compare Star Ratings Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital Shines in CMS' Hospital Compare Star Ratings Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Shines in CMS' Hospital Compare Star Ratings

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital Shines in CMSâ€™ Hospital Compare Star Ratings
TOLEDO, Ohio, March 4, 2019 – ProMedica is pleased to announce that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) has updated its Overall Hospital Quality Star Ratings and once again ProMedica Toledo Hospital has earned 5 stars, the highest possible.
 
The CMS star ratings, publicly available on the CMS Hospital Compare website, provide patients and families with a simple, objective way to learn about the quality of hospitals and compare facilities in their area. Criteria for the ratings include patient mortality, safety and experience.
 
Toledo Hospital, where many of the region’s most critically ill or injured patients are treated, continues to be nationally recognized and awarded for its clinical excellence. In addition to earning a 5-star rating by CMS, Toledo Hospital was recently named one of Healthgrades America’s 50 Best Hospitals for 2019, placing the hospital in the top one percent of more than 4,500 hospitals assessed nationwide for its consistent, year-over-year superior clinical performance.
 
"At ProMedica, we’re constantly working to be the best we can be to provide high quality care to our patients. We’re bringing the latest and most innovative technology to our hospitals, holding patient safety to the highest standard, reducing readmission rates, enhancing the patient experience, and in turn we’re living out our Mission to improve health and well-being in the communities we serve,” says Rajendra Kattar MD, President of ProMedica Heart Institute and 24/7 cardiologist at Toledo Hospital.
 
Rated on a five star scale, with one star representing the lowest ranking and five stars representing the highest ranking, ProMedica hospitals received the following ratings:
 
- ProMedica Toledo Hospital – 5 Stars
- ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital – 4 Stars
- ProMedica Bay Park Hospital– 4 Stars
- ProMedica Memorial Hospital – 4
- ProMedica Bixby Hospitals – 4 Stars
- ProMedica Flower Hospital – 3 Stars
- ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - 3 stars
- ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital – 3 stars
- ProMedica Herrick Hospital – 3 Stars
- ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital – 3 Stars

name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital Earns Lung Cancer Screening Center Designation by American College of Radiology Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital Earns Lung Cancer Screening Center Designation by American College of Radiology Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital Earns Lung Cancer Screening Center Designation by American College of Radiology

Press Release
ProMedica Memorial Hospital Earns Lung Cancer Screening Center Designation by American College of Radiology
FREMONT, Ohio, February 28, 2019 – ProMedica Fremont Memorial Hospital is pleased to become a designated Lung Cancer Screening Center by the American College of Radiology (ACR).

The ACR Lung Cancer Screening Center designation is a voluntary program that recognizes facilities that have committed to practice safe, effective diagnostic care for individuals at the highest risk for lung cancer. 

In order to receive this elite distinction, facilities must be accredited by the ACR in computed tomography in the chest module, as well as undergo a rigorous assessment of its lung cancer screening protocol and infrastructure. Also required are procedures in place for follow-up patient care, such as counseling and smoking cessation programs.

“The American Cancer Society estimates there will be over 140,000 deaths from lung cancer this year,” Nathan Egbert, MD, radiologist at Memorial Hospital. “Our goal at Memorial Hospital is to lower this number. Deaths caused by lung cancer can be decreased by quitting smoking and through routine screening in patients who are at high risk of developing lung cancer.”

Lung cancer screening with low-dose computed tomography scans, and appropriate follow-up care, significantly reduces lung cancer deaths. In December 2013, the United States Preventive Services Task Force recommended screening of adults aged 55 to 80 years who have a 30 pack-year smoking history and currently smoke or have quit within the past 15 years. Lung cancer is the nation’s leading cancer killer – taking the lives of more people each year than breast, colon and prostate cancers combined 

The ACR, founded in 1924, is one of the largest and most influential medical associations in the United States. The ACR devotes its resources to making imaging and radiation therapy safe, effective and accessible to those who need it. Its 36,000 members include radiologists, radiation oncologists, medical physicists, interventional radiologists and nuclear medicine physicians.

For more information about Memorial Hospital, visit www.promedica.org/memorial.

name: ProMedica Opens Third New Food Clinic at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Opens Third, New Food Clinic at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Opens Third, New Food Clinic at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

Press Release
ProMedica Opens Third, New Food Clinic at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

OREGON, Ohio, February 14, 2019 – ProMedica is pleased to announce the opening of a new Food Clinic at 2751 Bay Park Dr., Suite 110E, Oregon, Ohio, inside the Medical Office Building at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. This is the third Food Clinic location, with two others at the Center for Health Services and the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center.

The new location will be open on Thursdays and will provide food to patients in need of healthy food at home. In 2018, over 1,600 ProMedica patients in the Bay Park region screened positive for food insecurity. Patients screening positive can receive a referral from a ProMedica primary care provider to visit the Food Clinic at any of the three locations.

“The opening of ProMedica’s third Food Clinic location is just one way for us expand our reach in the community and to continue addressing food insecurity and ensuring people have access to healthy food,” said Kate Sommerfeld, President, Social Determinants of Health at ProMedica.

The ProMedica Food Clinic launched in April 2015 as a commitment to addressing food insecurity as one of the many social determinants of health in the community. The idea of the Food Clinic is “food is medicine.” Patients can shop for two to three days’ worth of food for their household per visit, once per month for up to six months, at which time patients can return to their provider for another referral if needed.

Patients are able to choose their own foods from the clinic, alongside an expert who considers the patient’s needs, health conditions and lifestyle. In addition, patients can receive nutrition counseling from a dietitian, nutrition education from a dietetic technician, healthy recipes, and connection to community resources. Since opening in 2015, the Food Clinics have served more than 6,600 unique households through more than 28,000 patient visits.

For more information about ProMedica Bay Park Hospital, visit www.promedica.org/baypark.

Press Release
Toledo Museum of Art Event to Celebrate Haircut Art and ProMedicaâ€™s Commitment to Addressing Racial Health Disparities

TOLEDO, Ohio, February 7, 2019 – ProMedica, together with the Toledo Museum of Art, present The Art of the Cut, an event that will examine the intersection of art and health while highlighting Toledo’s black barbers and their roles as artists and men’s health advocates.

On Feb. 17 from 3-7 p.m., The Toledo Museum of Art’s (TMA) GlasSalon at 2445 Monroe Street will be turned into a community barbershop with barbers demonstrating their artistic abilities. They will perform 16 haircuts in four rounds inspired by styles through the decades from the 1950s to 2000s, and they will participate in a final round inspired by works in the TMA collection.

These predominantly African American barbershops are among the participants in ProMedica’s Barbershop Health and Wellness Program, which provides barbers with education on prostate cancer and other screenings as well as health educational materials they can distribute to their clients.

In 2018, ProMedica’s Health and Wellness program expanded to address the significant health disparities of African American men as reported in the recent Lucas County Health Needs Assessments and the Ohio State Health Improvement Plan. These reports reveal health disparities in the African American male community with regard to heart disease, diabetes, prostate and colorectal cancer. Representatives will discuss these health disparities during the event.

“The barbershop program is about fostering trusting relationships between the community and healthcare providers while providing health screenings, health education, and resource information,” explained ProMedica Cancer Institute Community Liaison Robin Charney, who leads the program. “The response from the participating barbers has been phenomenal. They have the ear and the trust of the community and have allowed us to expand our health education and screening efforts.”

“Events like Art of the Cut celebrate those community connections,” Charney said. “Art presents us with an opportunity to bring the community closer, and every encounter we have with each other is an opportunity for wellness.”

The Art of the Cut is sponsored by Circle, a Museum affinity group whose diverse, civically, and culturally engaged members work with TMA and other community organizations to develop new, innovative ways of connecting the Toledo community with the Museum and art.

“The positive effect that art can have on health is often overlooked,” explained TMA Leadership Fellow Alyssa Greenberg. “The event positions art as something that is a positive social good; art is for everyone; art is even for people who think art is not for me. For the barbers, their effectiveness as community leaders and men's wellness advocates has everything to do with their capacity as artists.”

Les Levesque from Tal Mon, one of the Barbershop Program participants, is looking forward to participating in The Art of the Cut because of its potential to create connections.

“We live in a divided society, so this is an important opportunity to bring people together for a cause,” Levesque said. “Health and haircuts are two things that everyone needs so it was a natural fit to help educate my clients and the community about health screenings.”

Joining Levesque as co-hosts at the event are Jamal Grant (Da Shop), Tawann Gaston (Groomed), Stacey Fletcher (Fletcher's), Steve Parker (Steve's Sport-n-Cuts), and James Foster (James Foster).

About Toledo Museum of Art

Since its founding in 1901, the Toledo Museum of Art has earned a global reputation for the quality of our collection, our innovative and extensive education programs, and our architecturally significant campus. And thanks to the benevolence of its founders, as well as the continued support of its members, TMA remains a privately endowed, non-profit institution and opens its collection to the public, free of charge. For more information, please visit www.toledomuseum.org.

Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. name: ProMedica Launches Healthy Aging Institute Announces Leader Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Launches Healthy Aging Institute; Announces Leader Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Launches Healthy Aging Institute; Announces Leader

Press Release
ProMedica Launches Healthy Aging Institute; Announces Leader

TOLEDO, Ohio, February 6, 2019 – ProMedica, a not-for-profit, mission-based health and well-being organization, today announced it has established the ProMedica Healthy Aging Institute. The new institute leverages the unique strengths and capabilities of ProMedica and its recently added HCR ManorCare senior living division to help redefine healthy aging, provide a best-in-class experience to the nation’s growing senior population, and drive positive reform.

The institute’s structure will continue to be defined over the coming year and will be grounded in three core areas:

  • Innovation and research – Identifying and developing new health and wellness models for the senior population that promote healthy aging at all life stages
  • Education and training – Preparing the next generation of leaders and clinicians to support all aspects of senior health and well-being, including offering continuing education for people currently in the senior care field and those interested in entering the profession.
  • Advocacy – Serving as a catalyst for industry reform and leading the charge to redesign health care for seniors across the wellness spectrum

“As changing demographics substantially impact our population’s age composition, the healthcare industry faces significant challenges and opportunities,” said Randy Oostra, president and CEO of ProMedica. “While preparing to accommodate the healthcare demands of the growing senior population, we also must focus on bringing together people and resources in new ways to support healthy aging for all. ProMedica is in a unique position to lead the charge on that front, and establishing the ProMedica Healthy Aging Institute is a reflection of our commitment to doing so.”

ProMedica is pleased to announce that Holly Bristoll will expand her role to include providing executive leadership and strategic development for the new Institute. In this role, Ms. Bristoll will work across ProMedica to convene, connect and leverage talent, resources and capabilities to support the creation and implementation of the Institute. Additionally, she will build relationships with local, regional and national leaders and organizations to develop collaborative solutions that support healthy aging.

“The ProMedica Healthy Aging Institute will be instrumental as we head into the next chapter of senior care and work diligently to ensure that we continue to deliver a best-in-class aging experience for patients and their families,” said Steve Cavanaugh, president of ProMedica’s HCR ManorCare division. “We are delighted that Holly will be leading the new institute. Her extensive experience in developing strategic partnerships and new solutions to complex industry and system challenges will be a tremendous asset to this endeavor.”

“I am excited to work closely with Steve Cavanaugh and the HCR ManorCare team to lead the ProMedica Healthy Aging Institute,” said Holly Bristoll, chief integration officer, academic affiliations at ProMedica. "I believe this initiative offers an exceptional opportunity to make impactful, important contributions to the future of health care,” she added. “I am looking forward to exploring new ways ProMedica can leverage its unique combination of resources and partner with others to develop solutions that redefine healthy aging.”

Ms. Bristoll has been with ProMedica for 28 years, serving in variety of executive roles, including her current position leading the 50-year, $2.5 billion Academic Affiliation with The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences. During her tenure, she has held a number of positions involving strategic planning, business development and operational leadership, including serving as president of three separate ProMedica hospitals. Ms. Bristoll holds a Master of Business Administration degree from The University of Michigan and a bachelor’s degree from Michigan State University.

Title: Memorial Hospital unveils new renovations
Description:
Memorial Hospital unveils new renovations

Press Release
Memorial Hospital unveils new renovations

ProMedica Memorial Hospital recently unveiled its newly renovated spaces.

The $11.5 million project includes a new patient-centered unit that will provide care to pediatric, adult and senior patients, new registration bays that will reduce wait time, and a renovated lobby. The ground floor will have new echo lab, stress lab and EKG in their own department space. Cardiac/pulmonary rehabilitation space and pulmonary function has a new lab on the ground floor. The hospital also has a newly renovated gift shop and cafeteria.

Also newly renovated is the birthing center. It includes six newly built labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a new NST room in the birthing center. In each private birthing suite, mothers will be provided with new birthing beds, infant warmers and bassinets. Beds for fathers will also be provided to add comfort during their stay.

name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital cardiac cath lab recognized for excellence Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital cardiac cath lab recognized for excellence Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital cardiac cath lab recognized for excellence

Press Release
ProMedica Toledo Hospital cardiac cath lab recognized for excellence

The American College of Cardiology has recognized ProMedica Toledo Hospital for its demonstrated expertise and commitment in treating patients who come to a cardiac cath lab for care, including diagnostic catheterization and percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) procedures. Toledo Hospital was awarded the Cardiac Cath Lab Accreditation with PCI in August based on rigorous onsite evaluation of the staff’s ability to evaluate, diagnose and treat patients who come to the cardiac cath lab.

PCI is also known as coronary angioplasty. It is a procedure that opens narrowed or blocked coronary arteries with a balloon to relieve symptoms of heart disease or reduce heart damage during or after a heart attack. Hospitals that have proven exceptional competence in treating patients who require cardiac catheterization have standardized their assessment process for patients before undergoing catheterization to ensure quality and patient safety. They ensure that care in the procedure room for sedation, infection control, radiation safety, universal protocol, and time out procedures is fully coordinated. They have also mastered the appropriate transfer to a cath recovery unit to better monitor and track complications, enhance physician-to-patient communication, patient family communication, discharge instructions and follow-up information.

Hospitals receiving Cardiac Cath Lab Accreditation with PCI from ACC must take part in a multifaceted clinical process that involves: completing a gap analysis; examining variances of care; developing an action plan; a rigorous onsite interview; and monitoring for sustained success. Improved methods and strategies of caring for patients include streamlining processes, implementation guidelines and standards, and adopting best practices in the care of cath lab patients. Facilities that achieve accreditation meet or exceed an array of stringent criteria and have organized a team of doctors, nurses, clinicians and other administrative staff that earnestly support the efforts leading to improved patient outcomes.

“Our physicians, care providers and staff members are pleased to be recognized as one of only 13 cath labs in the United States, and the only one in Ohio, to be awarded with this accreditation,” said Praveen Tamirisa, MD, president, ProMedica Heart Institute. “Our physicians and clinicians are dedicated to improving the care for patients who need cardiac interventions through standardized processes to improve patient outcomes.” The ACC offers U.S. and international hospitals like Toledo Hospital access to a comprehensive suite of cardiac accreditation services designed to optimize patient outcomes and improve hospital financial performance. These services are focused on all aspects of cardiac care, including the cath lab.

For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

About the American College of Cardiology The American College of Cardiology is the professional home for the entire cardiovascular care team. The mission of the College and its more than 52,000 members is to transform cardiovascular care and to improve heart health. The ACC leads in the formation of health policy, standards and guidelines. The College operates national registries to measure and improve care, offers cardiovascular accreditation to hospitals and institutions, provides professional medical education, disseminates cardiovascular research and bestows credentials upon cardiovascular specialists who meet stringent qualifications.

name: Outstanding Anticoagulation Pharmacist Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: Outstanding Anticoagulation Pharmacist Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
Outstanding Anticoagulation Pharmacist

Press Release
Outstanding Anticoagulation Pharmacist

Jobst Vascular Institute Anticoagulation Care recognizes Angelo Iachini, PharmD for his great work ethic and patient care.

"What I love about this job is it combines my love of patient interaction, along with my knowledge, to manage a medication that can sometimes be difficult to do. I see most patients at least once a month and I can really connect with them on a personal level,” said Iachini.

Iachini graduated from The University of Toledo in 2015 with a Doctorate in Pharmacy. He continued on to complete a post graduate residency with the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Family Medicine Program. During this time, Iachini spent six weeks with the Jobst Anticoagulation Service and upon completion of his residency in 2016, he joined the team as a full time pharmacist.

Jobst Vascular Institute Anticoagulation Care is a specialized service that provides best-practice monitoring for patients taking anticoagulants. Our goal is to reduce the patient’s risk of new blood clots or bleeding. Our team of clinical pharmacists and support staff are specially trained to provide patient care that optimizes the use of medications. In addition to monitoring medications, Jobst Anticoagulation Care offers dosing instructions, patient and family education, procedure bridge therapy plans, and on-call staff who are available after hours, weekends, and holidays.

name: Total Hip Replacement  Anterior Approach
Title: Total Hip Replacement â€“ Anterior Approach
Description:
Total Hip Replacement - Anterior Approach

Press Release
Total Hip Replacement â€“ Anterior Approach

The anterior approach hip replacement refers to a minimally invasive surgical technique done from the front of the hip. Since the technique does not cut muscle or tendons, it reduces the risk of injury to muscles, soft tissue, tendons, vessels and nerves. Surgeons believe advantages to this approach may also include earlier and easier recovery, less pain and unrestricted movement after surgery.

Brian Hecht, MD received extensive training for the anterior approach and has been performing the hip replacements at Fostoria Community Hospital since September 2018. While Dr. Hecht has been doing traditional hip replacements for many years, he believes in the future of the anterior approach. “The difference is in the recovery,” he says, “because there is no muscle or tendon cutting, which mean less pain and faster restored mobility. This results in less chance for dislocation, shorter time in the hospital, less pain, a better range of movement, and less damage to muscles and soft tissues.”

Dr. Hecht refers to the anterior hip approach as a “game changer” as it will restore quality of life in a fraction of the time in comparison to traditional hip replacements.

To learn more about hip replacement surgery or to find an orthopaedic surgeon, contact the ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital surgery department at 419-436-6646.

Learn more about orthopaedic care at Fostoria Community Hospital

Learn more about orthopaedic care at ProMedica

name: ProMedica and The University of Toledo College of Nursing Expand Partnership Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica and The University of Toledo College of Nursing Expand Partnership Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica and The University of Toledo College of Nursing Expand Partnership

Press Release
ProMedica and The University of Toledo College of Nursing Expand Partnership

TOLEDO, Ohio, September 6, 2018- The University of Toledo College of Nursing and ProMedica today announced an expanded partnership to bolster nursing education and address current and future health care industry challenges. .

The planned partnership between UT College of Nursing and ProMedica will focus on enhancing undergraduate and graduate nursing education and high quality care while developing a clinical nursing workforce to help meet current and future health care needs in ProMedica’s local, regional and national service areas. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the United States is expecting 1.2 million job position vacancies for registered nurses by 2020.

The UT College of Nursing provides nursing education programs responsive to the changing needs of students and the health care environment. UT’s nationally ranked master’s and Doctor of Nursing Practice Program include a range of specialties, including adult gerontology primary care, pediatrics and psychiatric mental health. UT’s Post-Baccalaureate Doctor of Nursing Practice Program was the first such program in the state to take nurses to the highest level of clinical practice and position them as leaders in the health care field.

Through this partnership, ProMedica and UT will collaborate to develop innovative educational programs, diverse clinical experiences for students, interprofessional research collaborations and high quality professional development programs to improve health care in our community.

Additionally, the partnership will work to advance the nursing profession and health care by supporting the development of local, state and national policies.

“Our expanded partnership with The University of Toledo College of Nursing is a natural extension of the academic affiliation between ProMedica and The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, and it reflects our shared commitment to developing northwest Ohio into a premier hub of medical education and clinical care,” said Randy Oostra, president and CEO of ProMedica. “This is an especially exciting time to take this partnership to the next level given our recent addition of HCR ManorCare, and the increased opportunities to educate and better prepare nurses to meet the needs of the growing senior population.”

“Strengthening the University’s partnership with ProMedica provides exciting opportunities to expand clinical training opportunities for our nursing students and to increase academic-clinical collaboration to advance nursing education, research and practice,” said Dr. Sharon L. Gaber, president of The University of Toledo. “We are proud to build on our existing Academic Affiliation to continue to advance our region as an innovative leader in education and health care delivery. As part of this new partnership with the College of Nursing, research will be enhanced and the College of Medicine and Life Sciences, through the Academic Affiliation, is committing $1 million to collaborative research between the colleges.”

name: US News and World Reports Awards High Performing to Toledo Hospital
Title: U.S. News and World Reports Awards High Performing to Toledo Hospital
Description:
U.S. News High Performing Hospitals - TH

Press Release
U.S. News High Performing Hospitals - TH

Toledo, OH, August 15, 2018 – ProMedica Toledo Hospital is pleased to announce that we are rated high performing for 7 procedures or conditions and 3 specialties by US News and World reports.

To help patients decide where to receive care, U.S. News generates hospital rankings by evaluating data on nearly 5,000 hospitals in 16 adult specialties, 9 adult procedures and conditions and 10 pediatric specialties. To be nationally ranked in a specialty, a hospital must excel in caring for the sickest, most medically complex patients. The ratings in procedures and conditions, by contrast, focus on typical Medicare patients. Hospitals that do well in multiple areas of adult care may be ranked in their state and metropolitan area. This hospital achieved the highest rating possible in 7 procedures or conditions and 3 specialties.

Procedures and Conditions Awarded at Toledo Hospital:


Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair       Aortic Valve Surgery                         Colon Cancer Surgery

Heart Bypass Surgery                            Heart Failure                                     Hip Replacement

Knee Replacement


Specialties Awarded at Toledo Hospital:

Gastroenterology & GI Surgery             Neurology & Neurosurgery                 Pulmonology

 

A hospital's score is based on multiple data categories and receives one of three ratings -- high performing, average or below average. Hospitals that earned a high performing rating were significantly better than the national average.

Title: ProMedica Presents ONE Yoga Festival at Promenade Park Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Presents ONE Yoga Festival at Promenade Park

Press Release
ProMedica Presents ONE Yoga Festival at Promenade Park

TOLEDO, Ohio, August 8, 2018 Â­Â­– ProMedica is collaborating with several Toledo-area yoga and fitness studios to bring a day of well-being to downtown Toledo at the first ever ONE Yoga Festival at Promenade Park on Sunday, September 9. ONE Yoga Festival is an all-day event that will include yoga and meditation, fitness workshops, music, food, cooking demos, and other wellness activities. The festival will feature 17 yoga studios and over 30 vendors focused on healthy living.

DJ Taz Rashid will be bringing high vibrational energy throughout the festival by mixing beats of love, ancient new world, house, tribal, nu jazz/disco, funk, classic remixes and all the cosmic sounds. The Toledo Symphony Quartet will provide live music for the last class of the festival.

Money raised will benefit the ONE Yoga Outreach Program. All ages are welcome to enjoy this day of wellness. Participants are asked to bring a yoga mat. Guests can pre-purchase tickets for $20 before Friday, September 7 at noon, or purchase tickets for $30 at the door. Children ages 12 and under are free when accompanied by an adult.

In addition to the ONE Yoga Festival, on Saturday, September 8 from 6:30 to 7:45 p.m., DJ Taz Rashid, known for spinning Wanderlust festivals and his popular yoga playlists, will host a Rooftop Kick-Off Party, a “Sound-Off” yoga class, on the rooftop level of the ProMedica parking garage. Each participant will listen to music and the teacher’s instructions through his/her own pair of headphones. Tickets are $25.

For more information about ONE Yoga Festival or to purchase tickets, visit www.oneyogafestival.com.

name: ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare Form New Laboratory Joint Venture Partnership Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare Form New Laboratory Joint Venture Partnership Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare Form New Laboratory Joint Venture Partnership

Press Release
ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare Form New Laboratory Joint Venture Partnership

TOLEDO, Ohio, August 2, 2018 – ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare USA (Sonic Healthcare) is proud to announce the agreement to form a joint venture to enhance laboratory services for patients and healthcare providers throughout Ohio, Michigan, and parts of Indiana.

The joint venture will operate under the name of ProMedica Pathology Laboratories (PPL). This new entity combines the existing, high-quality, inpatient and outreach laboratory testing capabilities of ProMedica Laboratories with the outreach laboratory knowledge of Sonic Healthcare’s Pathology Laboratories (PathLabs) division, based in Toledo and the esoteric testing capabilities offered by Sonic Healthcare. 

The joint venture will provide inpatient reference testing services for ProMedica’s hospital-based rapid response laboratories, as well as a comprehensive menu of outreach testing services for physicians based in Ohio, Michigan, and parts of Indiana. 

The new partnership will provide more comprehensive and responsive laboratory services for local physicians and healthcare providers. As an added benefit, over 90 percent of the testing completed by PPL will be performed locally at the joint venture’s core laboratory in Toledo, maintaining critical jobs and skills along with the provision of healthcare services within the community. 

“ProMedica is extremely pleased to be participating in this joint venture with Sonic Healthcare. The newly combined organization has enabled us to expand the service as well as the geographic reach of ProMedica’s existing lab services. We expect the economies of scale from this partnership to help us bring better value to our patients and expand our service offerings,” said Kevin Webb, President, Provider, Acute and Ambulatory Care, at ProMedica. 

“We are delighted to be partnering with ProMedica. This new company, PPL, is the next step forward in a healthcare collaboration that combines the complementary expertise and capabilities of ProMedica and Sonic Healthcare to provide high quality, community based laboratory services in Ohio and beyond. It is also part of Sonic Healthcare’s national strategy to create innovative laboratory affiliations with leading health systems around the country” said Steve Shumpert, CEO of Sonic Healthcare.

For more information, visit the Sonic Healthcare website at www.Sonichealthcareusa.com.

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.

For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

name: ProMedica with the Addition of HCR ManorCare is Set to Transform Health Care for Seniors Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica with the Addition of HCR ManorCare is Set to Transform Health Care for Seniors Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica with the Addition of HCR ManorCare is Set to Transform Health Care for Seniors

Press Release
ProMedica with the Addition of HCR ManorCare is Set to Transform Health Care for Seniors

Our three Toledo-based companies – Welltower, ProMedica and HCR ManorCare – are working together to improve the health and well-being of an aging population.

  • Unique large-scale partnership covers full spectrum of health care with goal of redefining healthy aging for the future
  • Partnership created ~$7B health network with 70,000 employees in 30 states
  • Transaction boosted ProMedica into the top 15 largest U.S. Health Systems
  • ProMedica plans to invest as much as $400M of growth and upgrade capital over the next five years

TOLEDO, Ohio, July 26, 2018 - ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit healthcare system focused on improving health and well-being, today announced the finalization of the transaction that adds HCR ManorCare operations to the ProMedica organization. With HCR ManorCare being the nation's second largest post-acute and long-term care provider, this partnership has enabled ProMedica to significantly scale its system to become the 15th largest in the nation. The combined organization provides an unmatched breadth of services and capabilities, including: a hospital system, a physician group, telehealth, several health plans, an academic affiliation, skilled nursing, assisted living, rehab, home health and hospice.

Randy Oostra, president and CEO of ProMedica, is the CEO of the combined organization. Steve Cavanaugh, former CEO of HCR ManorCare, now serves as the president of the HCR ManorCare division at ProMedica.

“This partnership is groundbreaking. Together, we will redefine health care and its role in healthy aging,” said Randy Oostra, president and CEO at ProMedica. “We are focused on tearing down the walls between care delivery channels to provide simpler navigation across the care continuum, along with greater value. Further, we see a tremendous opportunity to engage ProMedica’s nationally-recognized, social determinants of health work to benefit seniors across the communities we serve.”

“This relationship is exciting because of all of the opportunities it creates. No other organization in the country offers the breadth of services and capabilities of our combined organizations,” said Steve Cavanaugh, president, HCR ManorCare division at ProMedica. “We are looking forward to leveraging our resources to create a new way of delivering better care and improving outcomes.”

While hospitals will always play a significant role in healthcare delivery, the “baby boomers” are aging and their expectations for safe and value-based health care are different than any other prior generation. Forecasts indicate that the 85-and-older population in the United States is expected to double over the next 20 years. This growth will exacerbate the inefficiencies of the current fragmented and costly health systems. This partnership is uniquely positioned to address these challenges by seamlessly coordinating care across multiple health delivery channels to improve quality and reduce the overall cost of care.

Toledo, Ohio-based Welltower Inc. (NYSE:WELL), the leading global real estate capital provider to the healthcare industry, played a major role in facilitating this transaction through its innovative approach to using healthcare infrastructure to optimize healthcare delivery to lower cost sites of care while driving improved outcomes.

“Together with ProMedica, one of the largest and most innovative health systems in the U.S., this acquisition of HCR ManorCare provides us the platform to think differently about where healthcare services are delivered, particularly with respect to the aging of the population,” said Tom DeRosa, Chief Executive Officer of Welltower. “The close of this transformative joint venture further validates our health system strategy through which we leverage high-quality real estate to optimize care delivery at lower cost sites of care while remaining focused on improved outcomes.”

For more information about ProMedica, visit www.promedica.org.

Download more information.

name: Eidi Family Donates 15 Million to ProMedicas Ebeid Neighborhood Promise
Title: Eidi Family Donates $1.5 Million to ProMedicaâ€™s Ebeid Neighborhood Promise
Description:
Eidi Family Donates $1.5 Million to ProMedica's Ebeid Neighborhood Promise, Helping to Ensure a Brighter Tomorrow

Press Release
Eidi Family Donates $1.5 Million to ProMedicaâ€™s Ebeid Neighborhood Promise, Helping to Ensure a Brighter Tomorrow

TOLEDO, Ohio, July 24, 2018 – On Thursday, July 19, ProMedica announced a $1.5 million gift from Ramy and Faye Eidi to the Ebeid Neighborhood Promise (ENP). This is a community initiative to strengthen neighborhoods by addressing the social determinants of health (SDOH) with a key focus on health, education, jobs and family stability. The donation is designed to specifically address education, hunger and nutrition. 

SDOH, or the conditions in which people live, work and play are an important part of their overall well-being. Up to 80% of an individual’s health can be attributed to lifestyle, environment and socioeconomic factors such as education, job status, income and community safety.

“We all have the ability to use our resources to impact others. That’s something Russ Ebeid knew, and continues through the Eidi family.” said Randy Oostra, ProMedica president and CEO. “Ramy and Faye are a shining example of the spirit we all know and want to embrace; to get up every day and say ‘I’m going to make an impact.’ They’re an example to our community, and their ability to make an impact is special.”

ProMedica is continuously enhancing its clinical care to include SDOH screening and interventions, as well as to improve SDOH indicators across the communities served. To help accomplish this goal is to help provide the tools, education and resources to improve health and well-being.

“My main goal in life can be broken down into two parts: to be a good role model to my children, so they can see I set a precedent of a strong education, work ethic and to always strive for success,” said Ramy Eidi. “Second is to work hard and build on my success so I can continue to give back as much as I can to Toledo and northwest Ohio. This region has given me so much, giving back while I’m alive is the least I can do and the only thing I can take with me at the end.”

The ENP will offer a full range of social and educational services to address community needs with a specific focus on children and families. The ENP’s goal is to significantly expand on the scope and purpose of the ProMedica Ebeid Institute to improve health and well-being starting with the UpTown area and later expanding to the Monroe Street Corridor and eventually outlying communities.

ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Opens Second Medical Office Building

On Tuesday, June 12, a ribbon cutting ceremony was held at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital to celebrate the opening of the second medical office building. “The new medical office building is a wonderful addition to Defiance Regional Hospital’s campus,” said Doug Bush, president of ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. “It allows patients to get the same, high quality care in a larger and more convenient space.”

name: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital goes back to school Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital goes back to school Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital goes back to school

Press Release
ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital goes back to school

Welcome to PMCRH school tele-medicine clinics!

We are very excited to be serving your student at our tele-medicine clinic.

The ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital (PMCRH) received a grant which allows us to bring state-of-the-art healthcare to Branch County schools through tele-health medicine. This process starts with the completion of the enclosed enrollment packet. This allows us to have access to your student's health history just as any doctor's office would. If you wish to be called before treatment, or wish to be present during an exam, we will be happy to accommodate you, in most cases.

The nurse will provide a physical assessment of your student and document the reason for the visit. When medically appropriate, your student will link to a PMCRH Pediatric and Adolescent Clinic physician or nurse practitioner where they can visually see the patient, as well as high-definition camera images of the exam in real time. The school clinic has special assessment equipment that links via Bluetooth to equipment in the Pediatric Clinic so that the provider can see and hear what the nurse sees and hears. We also have a high resolution camera for skin assessments. These images can be saved to the student's file for future reference and/or sent to your primary medical provider if you do not use the PMCRH Pediatric and Adolescent Clinic.

If prescriptions are needed, we are able to send them into your pharmacy of choice and will notify you of the need to pick them up, and provide a summary of your student's visit. Your insurance will be billed for the exam just as if your student went to the doctor's office. If your student does not have insurance, we will assist you in enrolling in one that works for you. No one will be denied healthcare due to the inability to pay.

Download our enrollment packet.

If you have any questions, please feel free to call 517-279-5295.

name: The Partnership for Excellence  Malcolm Baldrige Platinum Award for Excellence
Title: The Partnership for Excellence - Malcolm Baldrige Platinum Award for Excellence
Description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital earns Baldrige Platinum Award

Press Release
ProMedica Memorial Hospital earns Baldrige Platinum Award

ProMedica Memorial Hospital has earned The Partnership For Excellence (TPE) top recognition, the Platinum – Governor’s Award, TPE's highest honor; the hospital is one of only six organizations designated as a high-performing organization.

 

TPE’s independent board of examiners evaluated organizations in Ohio, Indiana and West Virginia according to the national Baldrige Excellence Framework. Applicants were evaluated on seven areas defined by the Baldrige Criteria: leadership; strategy; customers; measurement, analysis and knowledge management; workforce; operations; and results. The evaluation process for each of the recipients included more than 1,000 hours of review and a three-day visit by a team of examiners to clarify questions and verify information in the application.

 

The Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award recognizes U.S. organizations in the business, health care, education, and nonprofit sectors for performance excellence. The Baldrige Award is the only formal recognition of the performance excellence of both public and private U.S. organizations given by the President of the United States. It is administered by the Baldrige Performance Excellence Program, which is based at and managed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, an agency of the U.S. Department of Commerce.

 

So what happens next? In the weeks ahead, ProMedica Memorial Hospital will receive detailed reports from their TPE examination team detailing organizational strengths and, most importantly, opportunities for improvement. This valuable feedback will accelerate our efforts to continuously improve our performance.

Thank you for furthering our Journey of Excellence!

name: ProMedica Health System to Acquire HCR ManorCare Redefining Care for Seniors Toledo Ohio OH ProMedica Health System
Title: ProMedica Health System to Acquire HCR ManorCare Redefining Care for Seniors. Toledo, Ohio (OH), ProMedica Health System
Description:
ProMedica Health System to Acquire HCR ManorCare Redefining Care for Seniors.

Press Release
ProMedica Health System to Acquire HCR ManorCare Redefining Care for Seniors.
  • - Welltower and ProMedica enter into Joint Venture that will propel ProMedica to be in the top 15 largest U.S. Health Systems
  • - First of its kind partnership spans full spectrum of care, including wellness, skilled nursing, memory care, assisted living, hospice and home care
  • - Partnership to create an approximate $7B health network with 70,000 employees in 30 states
  • - ProMedica will invest as much as $400M of growth and upgrade capital over the next five years
  • - Welltower and ProMedica have jointly entered into agreement to acquire the real estate of Quality Care Properties
     
    TOLEDO, OH, April 25, 2018 — ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit healthcare system focused on improving health and well-being across the care continuum, announced today it is planning to acquire HCR ManorCare, the nation’s second largest provider of post-acute services and long-term care.

    The partnership will enable ProMedica to gain immediate scale in the fast-growing home health and post-acute care markets, obtain a best-in-class portfolio of assets staffed by highly trained and dedicated healthcare professionals, and develop a diversified business that can better evolve with the current healthcare industry.

    “We want to take down the wall between traditional hospital and post-acute care services in an effort to enhance the health and well-being of our aging population,” said Randy Oostra, ProMedica president and CEO. “The lines are blurring between where health care begins and stops. This acquisition provides us the platform to think differently about health and aging.”

    Individuals in their 70s and 80s are the fastest growing segment of the U.S. population, yet the current senior care environment is fragmented, costly and inefficient. Nearly eight million patients are using post-acute care services, presenting a significant opportunity to coordinate those services with healthcare systems to improve quality and reduce the overall cost of care.

    HCR ManorCare, based in Toledo, Ohio, has more than 50,000 employees providing services in 450 assisted living facilities, skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, and hospice and home health agencies operating under the respected names of Heartland, ManorCare Health Services and Arden Courts. Through this transaction, ProMedica, which operates in six states, will expand its footprint into 30 states, employing approximately 70,000 people with projected annual revenues of $7B.

    ProMedica and Welltower (NYSE:WELL), the world's premier health care real estate investment trust (REIT) and leading owner of senior living residences, entered into a strategic joint venture agreement to facilitate the acquisition of HCR ManorCare and Arden Courts real estate assets from Quality Care Properties, Inc. (NYSE:QCP). The resulting partnership will redefine the skilled nursing value paradigm and connect the continuum of care for the patients in the communities we serve.

    “This is an exciting opportunity for Welltower and singularly validates our strategy of partnering with major health systems to drive health care delivery to lower cost settings while improving health outcomes,” commented Welltower CEO Tom DeRosa. “This acquisition will enable ProMedica to expand their service offering beyond acute care hospitals to include home health, post-acute care and residential memory care. ProMedica’s unique wellness focused strategy and investment commitment to the HCR ManorCare assets will make them more consequential sites of care and enhance their value. We are very happy to be the real estate capital behind this transformative transaction.”

    “We are thrilled to have a successful outcome for our shareholders, HCR ManorCare employees and provide continuity and stability for the more than 200,000 of HCR ManorCare patients and residents,” said QCP CEO Mark Ordan. “ProMedica and Welltower together are redefining the settings where health care will be delivered and ProMedica is committed to the investment necessary to enhance the HCR ManorCare platform. QCP is happy to have played a part in facilitating this exciting next chapter for HCR ManorCare.”

    About ProMedica
    ProMedica is a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization headquartered in Toledo, Ohio. It serves communities in Ohio, Michigan, Indiana, Kentucky, Pennsylvania and West Virginia. To date, the organization offers acute and ambulatory care, an insurance company with a dental plan, and post-acute and academic business lines. The 13-hospital system has more than 17,000 employees, 2,700 physicians and advanced practice providers with privileges, and more than 900 healthcare providers employed by ProMedica Physicians. Driven by its Mission to improve your health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more information about ProMedica, please visit www.promedica.org/aboutus.

    About Welltower
    Welltower Inc. (NYSE:WELL), an S&P 500 company headquartered in Toledo, Ohio, is driving the transformation of health care infrastructure. The company invests with leading seniors housing operators, post-acute providers and health systems to fund the real estate infrastructure needed to scale innovative care delivery models and improve people's wellness and overall health care experience. WelltowerTM, a real estate investment trust (REIT), owns interests in properties concentrated in major, high-growth markets in the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom, consisting of seniors housing and post-acute communities and outpatient medical properties.  More information is available at http://welltower.com/.

    Forward-Looking Statements and Risk Factors
    This press release contains "forward-looking statements" as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. When Welltower and ProMedica use words such as "may," "will," "intend," "should," "believe," "expect," "anticipate," "project," "estimate," or similar expressions that do not relate solely to historical matters, they are making forward-looking statements. In particular, these forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, those relating to Welltower and ProMedica’s ability to close the HCR ManorCare joint venture transaction on currently anticipated terms, or within currently anticipated timeframes; the expected performance of Welltower, ProMedica, and HCR ManorCare’s operators/tenants and properties; Welltower, ProMedica, and HCR ManorCare’s expected occupancy rates; and Welltower and ProMedica’s ability to access capital markets or other sources of funds.
